commit_message:
Fixes FloatingIPDNS extension 'show' method.

Changes the 'show' method to also work when 'id' is actually
an IP and calls the right method to return a list of DNS entries
for a given domain and IP when the called method is
'v2/{tenant_id}/os-floating-ip-dns/{domain}/entries/{ip}'.

Fixes bug 1089410

Change-Id: I4c424e091209624324754c548e55bbbb304cf79f

'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2013-01-25 23:27:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

IMO, Jenkins unit test job failed due to a bug in compute cells code.

I have fixed this issue in the following patch and now all unit tests previously failing are successful.
{{{
diff --git a/nova/compute/cells_api.py b/nova/compute/cells_api.py
index d5427a0..9af739d 100644
--- a/nova/compute/cells_api.py
+++ b/nova/compute/cells_api.py
@@ -511,7 +511,7 @@ class ComputeCellsAPI(compute_api.API):
 
         volume = self.volume_api.get(context, volume_id)
         self.volume_api.check_detach(context, volume)
-        self._cast_to_cells(context, instance, 'detach_volume',
+        self._cast_to_cells(context, instance, '_detach_volume',
                 volume_id)
}}}

commit_message:
Fixes unhandled exception in detach_volume

* Fixes the use case where an exception should have been raised when libvirtd
goes down and a volume is being detached.
* Added unit tests for detach_volume, but skipped one unit test for compute
cells as it is giving an error (TypeError: detach_volume() takes exactly
3 arguments (4 given))

Fixes bug #1101079
Change-Id: I6d83947a0344c5f2d91014de6a2052a881198bb4

commit_message:
Show the details of the added bare-metal resource

On subcommand baremetal-node-create or baremetal-add-interface,
the details of the added resource (a node or an interface) are
printed. This is useful in a script (e.g. devstack).

Some refactoring are also included.

Change-Id: I25f019f3dda33de5b49ab2c5442762283be1cf5a

commit_message:
Check for non-default volume name template.

The iscsi delete methods in iscsi.py had hard-coded volume names
'volume-%s'.

If a user configured volume_name_template to
something other than default the result is failure to remove
the iscsi_target.

volume create worked appropriately and created the correct name
in the DB, so the persistence files were the only thing affected
or named incorrectly.

Fixes bug: 1101071

Change-Id: Id5575874b2cebd9b3509d739cb92abf06c503c4e

I have no opinion on whether other values should be accepted. If someone wants it, it'll be easy enough to add later."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-01-29 13:54:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

This is all opinion, but I'm not really a fan of saying:

  "Use OpenStack Identity API Version version 2.0."

A) the .0 implies that API v2.1 won't be used if it's available, which should be backwards compatible and preferred over 2.0. This is perhaps appropriate for /v2.0/ but will be counter-intuitive when /v3/ implies that 3.1, 3.2 implementations may/should be silently discovered and utilized.

B) ATM machine'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-01-31 20:08:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Today the only acceptable value is '2.0' but the API says to put 'v2.0' in the URI.  I don't see it as redundant because the second 'version' is part of the value being assigned to a variable name containing 'version'.

Regarding the 2.0 vs 2 bit, again the only acceptable value today is '2.0'.  I'd like to see '2' be equivalent to getting the most recent '2.x' version, but that's more of a subjective change as it starts to make assumptions about what the user wants.  We seem to shy away from that sort of thing in general around here..."}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-01-31 22:34:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Abandoned

More thinking leads me to agree with Dolph on the business with the 'v' in the version value.  I'll address the 2 vs 2.0 in another change."}]

commit_message:
Use the same version string as API spec

The API and service catalog use 'v2.0' for the API version;
the client should use the same string for its version sting
with --os-identity-api-version.  Silently allow old value
('2.0') for backward compatibility.

Change-Id: Ia75f6849ff1a6180ebf73d8e253c827abf98844b

commit_message:
Ensure AppArmor Utils package is Installed

    AppArmor Utils contains apparmor_parser which is used to
    disable/enable profiles.  Currently, we are disabling mysql
    apparmor profile in guest agent so we load new cnf file

Change-Id: I7b4158e8aeb757ddf35f63de5ff44e71420d6846
Fixes: bug #1107616

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-29 07:41:50.000000000', 'message': "Fix rebuild with volumes attached

This patch assumes that the correct behavior for instance rebuild is to
maintain attached volumes across a rebuild operation.

Two important changes are:

1) Detaching all volumes during a rebuild so that they won't be 'in-use'
   when prep_block_devices is called to reattach them.

2) xenapi: Allowing additional volumes, not just root volumes, to be
   attached before boot. To handle this, we cycle through all
   block-device-mappings, not just the root-device, create the VDI, and
   later, create the VBD.

Small changes include:

* Using `connection_data` instead of `dev_params` (to match other parts of
  the code base)

* Renaming `get_vdis_for_boot_from_vol` to `get_vdi_uuid_for_volume` to
  reflect its more general and simpler semantics.

Fixes bug 1071547

Change-Id: Ie54a16be4bae2a718ed7d506f32777d0847b9089

commit_message:
Fix rebuild with volumes attached

This patch assumes that the correct behavior for instance rebuild is to
maintain attached volumes across a rebuild operation.

Two important changes are:

1) Detaching all volumes during a rebuild so that they won't be 'in-use'
   when prep_block_devices is called to reattach them.

2) xenapi: Allowing additional volumes, not just root volumes, to be
   attached before boot. To handle this, we cycle through all
   block-device-mappings, not just the root-device, create the VDI, and
   later, create the VBD.

Small changes include:

* Using `connection_data` instead of `dev_params` (to match other parts of
  the code base)

* Renaming `get_vdis_for_boot_from_vol` to `get_vdi_uuid_for_volume` to
  reflect its more general and simpler semantics.

Fixes bug 1071547

Change-Id: Ie54a16be4bae2a718ed7d506f32777d0847b9089

commit_message:
DRYing up volume_in_mapping code.

Libvirt, VMWare, and Xen drivers all reimplement this method. This
refactors the code into the `block_device` module so all drivers can
share it.

Future Work: Refactor xen so that strip_prefix doesn't need to be passed
to `volume_in_mapping`.

Change-Id: I026b655f2eb7ea9cebe84058749c05ce93bcb7d4

commit_message:
Use _prep_block_device in rebuild.

This patch makes rebuild slightly more similar to build by calling the
same function to prep block devices.

Change-Id: I3040b49578ad0351be7819c29a449799f50c82a9

In the XenDriver, we determine which volumes to detach using the `osvol`
other_config, rendering `block_device_info`.

`destroy` still needs to take it as part of the virt-driver API, but
internal functions don't need it.

Change-Id: I1bbd69f41f9a1e18d4759d0ef3c6de027d3c9981

commit_message:
xenapi: Ax unecessary `block_device_info` params

The xenapi driver uses the 'osvol' other_config to determine which
volumes to detach, making `block_device_info` unecessary for internal
functions.

`destroy` still needs to accept the param since it's part of the
virt-driver API.

Change-Id: I1bbd69f41f9a1e18d4759d0ef3c6de027d3c9981

commit_message:
Code cleanup for rebuild block device mapping

* Removes extra call to get block-device-mappings when detaching during
  recreate.

* Untangle network handling from block-device handling in rebuild

* DRYs up evacuate hosts tests

* Temporary mutation supports dicts as well as objs

* Make instance recreate exceptions more specific to aid testing

Change-Id: I242f9f6a7d329f27b06b7e81b9a418e01682c82e

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-31 06:12:23.000000000', 'message': "Proposed EC2 OpenStack extension

'PAUSED' OS instance status is not mappable to any EC2 status correctly.
Adding a 'paused' status seams to the only viable way to handle this.

Normally you cannot reach this status just with the EC2 API, but all other
defined EC2 statuses are schematically incorrect for status mapping.

A suspend can be considered as a 'stopped' status.
'rebooting' can be considered as 'pending' status.

Change-Id: Id4500dd6e38e078d0b0b76fb0dd6a81c054ef646
"}, {'created': '2013-01-31 06:29:29.000000000', 'message': "Proposed EC2 OpenStack extension

'PAUSED' OS instance status is not mappable to any EC2 status correctly.
Adding a 'paused' status seams to the only viable way to handle this.

Normally you cannot reach this status just with the EC2 API, but all other
defined EC2 statuses are schematically incorrect for status mapping.

A suspend can be considered as a 'stopped' status.
'rebooting' can be considered as 'pending' status.

Using the 'paused' status is only valid when the VM paused because
of the user's explicit request, so it is not temporary pause because
of an internal operation sequence. If the nova just pauses the VM
just temporary it must report 'pending' (or 'running' ) status.

Change-Id: Id4500dd6e38e078d0b0b76fb0dd6a81c054ef646
"}]
commit_message:
Proposed EC2 OpenStack extension

'PAUSED' OS instance status is not mappable to any EC2 status correctly.
Adding a 'paused' status seams to the only viable way to handle this.

Normally you cannot reach this status just with the EC2 API, but all other
defined EC2 statuses are schematically incorrect for status mapping.

A suspend can be considered as a 'stopped' status.
'rebooting' can be considered as 'pending' status.

Using the 'paused' status is only valid when the VM paused because
of the user's explicit request, so it is not temporary pause because
of an internal operation sequence. If the nova just pauses the VM
just temporary it must report 'pending' (or 'running' ) status.

Change-Id: Id4500dd6e38e078d0b0b76fb0dd6a81c054ef646

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-31 19:07:14.000000000', 'message': 'Fixed redstack to enable host ips other than 10.0.0.1

There were a few places in redstack, reddwarf conf files, and diskimage-builder
files where we were assuming that the host would always be at 10.0.0.1. This was
tripping up the devstack-vm-gate which has the host as 10.1.0.1 . Fixed the
scripts and config files to use the NETWORK_GATEWAY from the devstack configuration.
We fall back to 10.0.0.1 if no NETWORK_GATEWAY is specified as the default behaviour.

This fixes bug 1108372

Change-Id: Ib53ff3548269abd1b9e006d71382a417237f0068
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed redstack to enable host ips other than 10.0.0.1

There were a few places in redstack, reddwarf conf files, and diskimage-builder
files where we were assuming that the host would always be at 10.0.0.1. This was
tripping up the devstack-vm-gate which has the host as 10.1.0.1 . Fixed the
scripts and config files to use the NETWORK_GATEWAY from the devstack configuration.
We fall back to 10.0.0.1 if no NETWORK_GATEWAY is specified as the default behaviour.

This fixes bug 1108372

Change-Id: Ib53ff3548269abd1b9e006d71382a417237f0068

messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-31 18:17:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/20345/1/check/gate-reddwarf-pep8/249 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/20345/1/check/gate-reddwarf-python26/249 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/20345/1/check/gate-reddwarf-python27/249 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 694, 'date': '2013-01-31 18:17:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Another comment: if you see really low coverage results, check the report for the module reddwarf.taskmanager.models (./cover/_tox_cover_lib_python2_7_site-packages_reddwarf_taskmanager_models.html). If the "create_instance" method of "FreshInstanceTasks" isn't hit, something is wrong with coverage as that code should always be touched when creating an instance.'}, {'account_id': 694, 'date': '2013-01-31 18:17:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

(2 inline comments)

Without "--timid" the coverage drops from 71% to 40%. Please change the tox.ini file according to my comments, I downloaded your patch and verified it on OSX.

Note that coverage is a fickle beast. I personally don't need to run the tests twice to get correct coverage results but that was the case in the past when I was running tox on a Ubuntu machine. 

Good job on cleaning up the tox.ini file and adding the new unit tests.'}, {'account_id': 739, 'date': '2013-01-31 18:17:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

lol.. .forgot to -1 this. See previous comment about your commit msg."}, {'account_id': 739, 'date': '2013-01-31 18:17:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We need a human readable summary as the first line, followed by a blank line, followed by all that other stuff.

Just replace "bug 1103637" with something that a user can read when scanning thru git logs'}, {'account_id': 4693, 'date': '2013-01-31 18:17:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I've setup the whole environment from scratch again. I always get the same results, w/wo --timid, be that in the config file or the command line. also, the method you specified never seem to hit.

Please notice that the way it was written before had two major flaws:

1. it wasn't looking into 0% files - i'm using the --source so i'm getting those as well - maybe this is why you see lower coverage now?
2. it used the -p which makes coverage spit out a "temp" coverage file that looks like: .coverage.some.more.text.and.numbers Now, unless you run coverage combine (which will collect all such "temp" files in current dir and combine into a single .coverage file) there is no meaning to running the coverage html. it doesn't look into those temp files at all. so normally will not generate any coverage report, or, might pick up some older .coverage file you might have.

Are you sure you are getting different results w/wo --timid? are you sure your results are correct?
I don't mind adding the --timid if you guys insist, but i can't say i understand why.

thanks.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-31 18:17:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/20345/2/check/gate-reddwarf-pep8/257 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/20345/2/check/gate-reddwarf-python26/257 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/20345/2/check/gate-reddwarf-python27/257 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 694, 'date': '2013-01-31 18:17:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

I'm not sure why -p is needed but it is. I was not running coverage combine but let's add it to be safe.

If you make the two changes I suggest you should see 71% coverage. I just had a coworker locally download your patch, change the tox.ini file as I described, and it worked for him."}, {'account_id': 694, 'date': '2013-01-31 18:17:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

PS- Most likely code hit via wsgi intercept is not being caught w/o timid. That's my guess why it's required. If you find a way to show all the code the tests are hitting without it we can change it."}, {'account_id': 694, 'date': '2013-01-31 18:17:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I am not suggesting we not run coverage combine. Check my last comment, I mention that we should go ahead and add it.'}, {'account_id': 4693, 'date': '2013-01-31 18:17:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Tim, i'm afraid adding the -p is wrong. please do the following and see for yourself:
* make sure you have no cover folder (the html report output folder) and no .coverage files in your current folder. so no .coverage nor anything else like: .coverage.Drors-MacBook-Air.local.9590.627280
* run this: coverage run -p run_tests.py
* run ls. see that you now have one .coverage.xxx.xxx file and no .coverage file
* try running: coverage html. see that you get: No data to report. and no cover folder is being created. (i'm assuming you are doing this in this change's environment, so you have the valid .coveragerc file, otherwise, add -d for the html output folder, etc.)
* now, only after running coverage combine, you'll see you have a "clean" .coverage file, and now running coverage html produces the output.

for coverage html to work, a .coverage file must be present, and this file is only generated without the -p or after running coverage combine. we're not supposed to use -p ...

i'm afraid you have a dirty environment that confuses you. please do the above and update me on your findings so we can move forward with this fix.

thanks'}, {'account_id': 4693, 'date': '2013-01-31 18:17:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-31 18:17:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/20345/3/check/gate-reddwarf-pep8/261 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/20345/3/check/gate-reddwarf-python26/261 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/20345/3/check/gate-reddwarf-python27/261 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 739, 'date': '2013-01-31 18:17:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I checked the 3rd patchset out in fresh directories and ran them, and achieved the same 71% as with -p. I also did it w/o --timid and also got 71%. This is valid. Lets take timid out of it.'}, {'account_id': 4693, 'date': '2013-01-31 18:17:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

well, i think i've found the problem. i forgot to delete this line from the tox.ini:
setenv = NOSE_WITH_COVERAGE=1
it's no longer needed, since we run coverage directly and not through the nose plugin.
i left the --timid there, though i believe it should work the same w/wo it. i suggest we leave it "as is" for now and attend to it at the second pass (when we figure out why python-path doesn't have the '.' ...)'}, {'account_id': 4693, 'date': '2013-01-31 18:17:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-31 18:17:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Fails

commit_message:
Fixing the coverage reports for the unittests and adding support for TestR.

Now they work better and also include coverage for the tests invoked by testr.

Change-Id: Ia48cf4664ce9ec46f7ef21929b0d87cad4149580
Fixes: bug #1103637

commit_message:
heat api : add register_api_opts to init.py

Add register_api_opts to api/__init__.py, slightly simplifying
the api executables, and also solving an issue with some tests
which were not working via nosetests -s due to the required
options not being registered in cfg.CONF

Change-Id: I70b16aae1f73f72518013dbcda37defa79fc5649
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

is never called, so these tests fail when run via nosetests

Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
heat tests : add missing heat.engine import

Need to import heat.engine otherwise register_engine_opts
is never called, so these tests fail when run via nosetests

Change-Id: Ib4ee2771582b29855b7fbd8b38319666917de99f
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Prints list-cached dates in isoformat

Converts dates printed by list-cached to a human readable format
(isoformat). It now checks whether the image last_access time is == 0.0
and prints "Not Accessed Yet" if so.

* Updates openstack.common.timeutils
* Fixes bug 1102334

Change-Id: I46f023471ec87fdf74c18f33309279a2f39a4e2a

commit_message:
Fix typo in image-update help page

The image-update help page reversed the DISK_FORMAT
and CONTAINER_FORMAT metavars.

Fixes bug #1111054

commit_message:
Domain_id should be optional for Projects

Like User and Group, the domain_id should be an optional attribute for
a Project, as opposed to being required. Also updated the desciption of
the domain that will be used if it is not specified by the cleint for
Users, Groups and Projects

bug #1110758

Change-Id: Ia100d15b9988c056485eea4393a05734c44f915e

commit_message:
Fix kwargs in xattr BadDriverConfiguration exc.

Updates an exception in the xattr image_cache driver so that
it uses the correct kwargs for message formatting.

Change-Id: I045de0fcd0237ed2702cf13d911d5b14ea86f45b

commit_message:
Pass parameter 'filter' back to model layer

This allows the API to pass back additional arguments to filter search
results by.  This will be useful for resource tagging or other filters.

DocImpact: Adds 'Filter' parameter to DescribeInstance (see
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/ApiReference-query-DescribeInstances.html)

Fixes: bug #922835

Change-Id: I58cc12df650829ed7eb685184a22186d8a5406f4
Signed-off-by: Stephen Gran <stephen.gran@guardian.co.uk>

commit_message:
Simplify ceilometer-api and checks Keystone middleware parsing

This adds some test to be sure options passed to the middleware are read and
user properly.

This fixes bug #1099739

Change-Id: I491db4d2c7387cc2848ebefbbb579597234a82b0
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
Use WSME 0.5b1

There is now an official package of a version of WSME
containing all of the patches we need, so update our
requirements list.

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Adds support of TCP protocol for LBaaS VIPs.

Adds validation of supplied protocols for VIPs and Pools at API and DB levels.
Modifies the schema of the database to allow storing TCP VIPs.

Change-Id: Idab3139f280b5f0a16633974c05f88d70fb8d683
Fixes: bug #1100724

commit_message:
heat engine : WaitConditionHandle use creation time for timestamp

Use the resource creation time for the pre-signed URL timestamp,
otherwise you get a different timestamp/signature every time you
refer to the resource, which makes things like comparing templates
for update more difficult.

Change-Id: Ieb4a6269cfcaf1214c08442db03772fdd7570d59
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
heat engine : don't treat UPDATE_COMPLETE as failure

The parser update logic currently treats UPDATE_COMPLETE
as a failure, which is incorrect

Change-Id: Ibac98fc08cdf3653be80cedfc3ed8ecb5c3eba8f
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
heat engine : pass fully resolved template to update

We need to pass the fully resolved (static and runtime)
resource template into the resource update(), so the
resource can compare pre/post update templates properly

Change-Id: I2fba2fef9c9f9ccb9b7cde9bd24bd06af7659240
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
heat engine : add Resource update_template_diff method

Add method to top-level Resource class update_template_diff()
which allows us to determine the difference between old/new
templates for a resource update, and also raise an error
if the changed keys are not in the list of those defined
as supported for update by the resource

ref blueprint instance-update-stack

Change-Id: Ibef07a0cecbc15f7f1d6c2c663743e3af8023057
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
heat engine : pass json snippet into resource handle_update

Change handle_update to accept the resource json_snippet,
needed to decide if a non-replacement update is possible
by comparing pre and post update resource definitions

ref blueprint instance-update-stack

Change-Id: I7eedce41eae232330f6fce4f098183cbd7fd6768
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
heat engine : don't replace resource template before update

We want to validate the pre-update properties without touching
the existing template, because the resource implementation will
need to compare old/new json snippets to decide if a and update
can be performed or not.

ref blueprint instance-update-stack

Change-Id: I37ce6e799242819de6104a53f8458d8bbc3abf1c
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Generic iSCSI copy volume<->image.

Implements a generic version of copy_volume_to_image and
copy_image_to_volume for iSCSI drivers.

Change-Id: Iff097629bcce9154829a7eb5aee0ea6302338b26
Implements: blueprint generic-iscsi-copy-vol-image

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-29 21:00:34.000000000', 'message': 'Wait for deletion of Instances during creation

When an Instance was still in the BUILD state when it was deleted, the
resource was not waiting for the instance to be deleted before declaring
success and moving on.

Change-Id: I05d553fedf10e01a06e20ca0e8ccbbbf463980e4
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Wait for deletion of Instances during creation

When an Instance was still in the BUILD state when it was deleted, the
resource was not waiting for the instance to be deleted before declaring
success and moving on.

Change-Id: I05d553fedf10e01a06e20ca0e8ccbbbf463980e4
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-29 21:00:34.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Instance deletion in unit tests

We need to actually return a NotFound exception from the nova client,
rather than just relying on it returning a status other than ACTIVE.

Change-Id: I1bb0d07db0ffb5c0ed780eb4ca7f5d7ddb98510e
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Instance deletion in unit tests

We need to actually return a NotFound exception from the nova client,
rather than just relying on it returning a status other than ACTIVE.

Change-Id: I1bb0d07db0ffb5c0ed780eb4ca7f5d7ddb98510e
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove redunant key list generation in Cisco plugin

Evaluates existance of key directly on dictionary.

Fixes bug #1110957

commit_message:
The change implements LBaaS CLI commands.

Implements: blueprint lbaas-cli

New commands:
 * Vip: lb-vip-create, lb-vip-list, lb-vip-show, lb-vip-update,
   lb-vip-delete
 * Pool: lb-pool-create, lb-pool-list, lb-pool-show, lb-pool-update,
   lb-pool-delete, lb-pool-stats
 * Member: lb-member-create, lb-member-list, lb-member-show,
   lb-member-update, lb-member-delete
 * Health Monitor: lb-healthmonitor-create, lb-healthmonitor-list,
   lb-healthmonitor-show, lb-healthmonitor-update, lb-healthmonitor-delete,
   lb-healthmonitor-associate, lb-healthmonitor-disassociate

Change-Id: Idaa569024c24955886a836e3dfedd009fed87007

Updates the Cinder config default for osapi_volume_extension
so that it only uses the new cinder.api.contrib.standard_extensions

Previously both the new and old extension loader path were listed

Fixes LP Bug #1107963.

Change-Id: I4e060fc8dcc49d8285e0e7db57489d10aa6d193a
'}, {'created': '2013-01-28 17:11:56.000000000', 'message': 'Update osapi_volume_extension default.

Updates the Cinder config default for osapi_volume_extension
so that it only uses the new cinder.api.contrib.standard_extensions
loader.

Previously both the new and old extension loader path were listed
which can cause extensions to be loaded twice thus causing
log WARNINGs to appear in the Cinder API log file.

Also, regenerates the cinder.conf.sample to reflect this change.

Fixes LP Bug #1107963.

Change-Id: I4e060fc8dcc49d8285e0e7db57489d10aa6d193a

commit_message:
Update osapi_volume_extension default.

Updates the Cinder config default for osapi_volume_extension
so that it only uses the new cinder.api.contrib.standard_extensions
loader.

Previously both the new and old extension loader path were listed
which can cause extensions to be loaded twice thus causing
log WARNINGs to appear in the Cinder API log file.

Also, regenerates the cinder.conf.sample to reflect this change.

Fixes LP Bug #1107963.

Change-Id: I4e060fc8dcc49d8285e0e7db57489d10aa6d193a

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-27 23:08:45.000000000', 'message': 'Do not require projedts to set the log_name option

Applications are supposed to configure the root logger
so that libraries can use well-defined names for logging
instead of having names passed in. Rather than forcing
all projects to define and configure a log_name option
for logging the keystone middleware, allow the option
to be missing, catch the exception, and use the module
name as a default logger name.

Change-Id: Id4e362a28b211d571e57b4bfd38fa0066e0b0b6a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>
'}, {'created': '2012-12-27 23:11:14.000000000', 'message': 'Do not require projects to set the log_name option

Applications are supposed to configure the root logger
so that libraries can use well-defined names for logging
instead of having names passed in. Rather than forcing
all projects to define and configure a log_name option
for logging the keystone middleware, allow the option
to be missing, catch the exception, and use the module
name as a default logger name.

Change-Id: Id4e362a28b211d571e57b4bfd38fa0066e0b0b6a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>
'}, {'created': '2013-01-15 18:25:14.000000000', 'message': 'Provide default for log_name option

Provide a default for the log_name option, but still use get() to
access the value from the config object in case it is a dictionary
instead of a configuration object.

Change-Id: Id4e362a28b211d571e57b4bfd38fa0066e0b0b6a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Provide default for log_name option

Provide a default for the log_name option, but still use get() to
access the value from the config object in case it is a dictionary
instead of a configuration object.

Change-Id: Id4e362a28b211d571e57b4bfd38fa0066e0b0b6a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Split stack user creation out of devstack element.

This makes it easy to create a local user without cloud init, for vm
instances.

Change-Id: Ifaae67418a725eb5a39cf9e46f0804b09986f63c

commit_message:
Include rootwrap.xml in the compute admin guide

There was documentation in the repo that describes how rootwrap works,
but it wasn't actually included in any of the OpenStack doc books as
far as I could tell. This patch includes it in the compute admin guide,
which is where the file is located.

Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/20551

Change-Id: I5e5e0581719e965f0949494623ec4b1de1817348

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-30 23:27:24.000000000', 'message': "Make scheduler modules pass conductor to add_instance_fault

The add_instance_fault_from_exc() method was recently changed to
take a conductor to avoid direct database access. The scheduler was
not updated for this, and thus was not passing it in a couple of
cases.

This makes those calls pass a conductor LocalAPI, resulting in direct
database access (which is desired from the scheduler). The tests that
one might have thought would catch this didn't because they mock out
the method itself. This fixes those and adds two tests that exercise
the add_instance_fault path all the way down to the DB API, which
would have caught it in the first place.

Fixes bug 1110808

Change-Id: If1c2988487d408a39fdf4080541f58f6bdac216c
"}, {'created': '2013-01-31 00:17:56.000000000', 'message': "Make scheduler modules pass conductor to add_instance_fault

The add_instance_fault_from_exc() method was recently changed to
take a conductor to avoid direct database access. The scheduler was
not updated for this, and thus was not passing it in a couple of
cases.

This makes those calls pass a conductor LocalAPI, resulting in direct
database access (which is desired from the scheduler). The tests that
one might have thought would catch this didn't because they mock out
the method itself. This fixes those and adds two tests that exercise
the add_instance_fault path all the way down to the DB API, which
would have caught it in the first place.

Fixes bug 1110808

Change-Id: If1c2988487d408a39fdf4080541f58f6bdac216c
"}]
commit_message:
Make scheduler modules pass conductor to add_instance_fault

The add_instance_fault_from_exc() method was recently changed to
take a conductor to avoid direct database access. The scheduler was
not updated for this, and thus was not passing it in a couple of
cases.

This makes those calls pass a conductor LocalAPI, resulting in direct
database access (which is desired from the scheduler). The tests that
one might have thought would catch this didn't because they mock out
the method itself. This fixes those and adds two tests that exercise
the add_instance_fault path all the way down to the DB API, which
would have caught it in the first place.

Fixes bug 1110808

Change-Id: If1c2988487d408a39fdf4080541f58f6bdac216c

commit_message:
Remove remaining instance_type db fetches from compute/api

While compute/api still contains some direct database hits for
looking up instance_type information, most are only encountered
in calls that initiate from nova-api.

This patch marks nova-api-initiated methods that do direct calls,
and refactors the rest to avoid them.

Related to blueprint no-db-compute

Change-Id: I6579996191d4761fa5e4b3a272517678e8f567ce

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/20576/'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-01-31 01:46:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Reverted to patch #1 and Edited HACKING.rst

I'll address Mark's comments in another patch"}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-01-31 01:46:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi 
Thanks for your cleaning up!

I think bug report for this fix is needed.
Could you update hacking file also?'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-01-31 01:46:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This change and the related bug would appear to be a stylistic preference that is being imposed arbitrarily on the project.  There are frequently many syntactic ways to accomplish something in python, and I'm not sure of the wisdom of restricting contributors to a particular syntax unless community consensus justifies such a restriction.  Can you please point me to evidence of such a consensus (e.g. via the mailing list, irc, other core projects, etc) that suggested this change?"}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-01-31 01:46:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I would note that the commit to openstack common does not mandate that subsequent commits follow this convention, so the issue of community consensus would appear to be still outstanding.

I would be supportive of this change if it could be automatically enforced (via pep8 and the like), but an update to HACKING indicates that reviewer vigilance will be required.  Given that 'not a [operator] b' and 'a not [operator] b' are logically equivalent, I'm hard-pressed to see why updating HACKING could be justified.

And frankly, I'm not sure I see the point of this change at all.  It marginally improves on readability in the codebase, but at an unnecessary cost of reviewer resources which could be better spent evaluating useful commits.  If your intention is to improve the style of the codebase in such marginal and mechanical ways, I would encourage you to gain consensus among the community that such efforts are valued, and if so, work with the CI team to have the code automatically evaluated and perhaps transformed. 

Note that a summit session is being proposed that is intended to develop guidelines for submission of style-focused commits to core projects."}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2013-01-31 01:46:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2013-01-31 01:46:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

I think that refactoring things one at a time and having each commit do one thing is the right way to go. The previous submission which only changed "not ... in" to "not in" was better and I would've preferred that the other issues be solved into separate commits.'}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2013-01-31 01:46:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-01-31 01:46:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(7 inline comments)

The changes to do make some things more pythonic, but there are other areas where the rest of the conditional should be cleaned up too."}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-01-31 01:46:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(1 inline comment)

Thanks for revising.  The changes work for me.  The inline comments do raise a good point and we should fallback to a less disruptive change and do some more research.'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2013-01-31 01:46:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-01-31 01:46:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Stop using detailed-errors plugin for nose.

Because of the move to testtools, the detailed-errors plugin is not only no
longer useful, it actually causes problems, as it fails to process the
error information sent up by testtools.

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools

Change-Id: I0c8ff489fa92bb4cf7dcd06dd73f14701c013608

Add option to clear environment

This adds an option to disk-image-create that allows it to re-exec with
an empty environment if required.

Also made even chunked transfer encoded object puts at least do a fallocate of zero bytes to cause the reserve check to happen."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-18 18:43:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2012-12-20 21:11:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Results of a few tests on my SAIO to see what happens on a full drive:

Fill up the drive with dd and then touch files until you get "no space left"

fallocate in swift will never get called because the mkstemp will fail with an OSError when trying to create either the temporary directory or temp file. This error isn't caught in the object server (line 616: "with file.mkstemp() as fd:") and therefore the object server returns 500 and not 507.

If you only fill up the drive with dd and then don't touch the extra files, then fallocate(fd, 0) doesn't fail. So what's the point? In what case will asking the fs to allocate zero bytes cause an error?

Finally, even if a drive is full and a handoff is chosen, replication will move the data right back (even with the buffer space that this patch adds). So I'm not sure what "systems behav[ing] badly" that the commit message indicates really means or what this patch fixes.'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-12-20 21:40:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-12-20 21:42:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I'll resubmit this later when it makes more sense. I was hoping to break up some work I'm doing into easier to review pieces, but it'll probably take even more explaining."}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-01-25 03:38:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Restored

Okay, about to bring this patch back with updates.'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-01-25 03:39:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-01-25 03:50:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

John, to reply to your points from before:

    > Fill up the drive with dd and then touch files until you get "no space
    > left" fallocate in swift will never get called because the mkstemp will
    > fail with an OSError when trying to create either the temporary directory
    > or temp file. This error isn't caught in the object server (line 616:
    > "with file.mkstemp() as fd:") and therefore the object server returns 500
    > and not 507.

I'm going to leave a fix for this off this patch. It's an existing thing that definitely should be fixed whether this patch is accepted or not, and I don't want this patch to get any bigger if possible.

    > If you only fill up the drive with dd and then don't touch the extra
    > files, then fallocate(fd, 0) doesn't fail. So what's the point? In what
    > case will asking the fs to allocate zero bytes cause an error?

A fallocate of zero bytes when under the reserve should fail. I added a couple extra tests to show this.

    > Finally, even if a drive is full and a handoff is chosen, replication
    > will move the data right back (even with the buffer space that this patch
    > adds).

This is why I pulled this patch and am now resubmitting it. redbo made a quick patch to rsync to fix this issue. See:

https://github.com/rackspace/cloudfiles-rsync/blob/master/rsync-3.0.7/debian/patches/limit-fs-fullness.diff

As far as what "behave badly" means, we've run across hardware that just locks up processes when disk space reaches zero. Not sure if it's a hardware controller issue or a kernel driver issue or what, but if 1 drive on a 90 drive system that fills up, it will eventually lock up all the object-server workers, which sucks.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-25 03:56:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see http://wiki.openstack.org/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/18290/4/check/gate-swift-docs/1248 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/18290/4/check/gate-swift-pep8/1391 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/18290/4/check/gate-swift-python26/1496 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/18290/4/check/gate-swift-python27/1498 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/18290/4/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/28253 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/18290/4/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/2757 : FAILURE
"}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-01-25 04:11:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-01-25 04:14:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> If you only fill up the drive with dd and then don't touch the extra
    > files, then fallocate(fd, 0) doesn't fail. So what's the point? In what
    > case will asking the fs to allocate zero bytes cause an error?

Ah, I see where the problem was now. It was in the fallocate function that calls the FallocateWrapper. The wrapper was fine and tested, the fallocate function wasn't. I've fixed that right quick and I guess I'll add some tests for it next. None of this was tested prior. :/"}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-01-25 04:26:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-01-25 04:37:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-25 04:56:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-18 03:56:51.000000000', 'message': 'Added fallocate_reserve option

Some systems behave badly when they completely run out of space. To
alleviate this problem, you can set the fallocate_reserve conf value
to a number of bytes to "reserve" on each disk. When the disk free
space falls below this amount, fallocate calls will fail, even if the
underlying OS fallocate call would succeed. For example, a
fallocate_reserve of 10737418240 (10G) would make all fallocate calls
fail, even for a zero-byte files, when the disk free space falls
under 10G.

The default fallocate_reserve is 0, meaning "no reserve", and so the
software behaves exactly as it always has unless you set this conf
value to something non-zero.

Also fixed ring builder's search_devs doc bugs.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I8db176ae0ca5b41c9bcfeb7cb8abb31c2e614527

Some systems behave badly when they completely run out of space. To
alleviate this problem, you can set the fallocate_reserve conf value

commit_message:
Added fallocate_reserve option

Some systems behave badly when they completely run out of space. To
alleviate this problem, you can set the fallocate_reserve conf value
to a number of bytes to "reserve" on each disk. When the disk free
space falls at or below this amount, fallocate calls will fail, even
if the underlying OS fallocate call would succeed. For example, a
fallocate_reserve of 5368709120 (5G) would make all fallocate calls
fail, even for zero-byte files, when the disk free space falls under
5G.

The default fallocate_reserve is 0, meaning "no reserve", and so the
software behaves exactly as it always has unless you set this conf
value to something non-zero.

Also fixed ring builder's search_devs doc bugs.

Related: To get rsync to do the same, see
https://github.com/rackspace/cloudfiles-rsync
Specifically, see this patch:
https://github.com/rackspace/cloudfiles-rsync/blob/master/debian/patches/limit-fs-fullness.diff

DocImpact

Change-Id: I8db176ae0ca5b41c9bcfeb7cb8abb31c2e614527

commit_message:
Fix bash completion on osx

The osx version of sed does not support \s so replace uses of it
with [ 	] and clean up the regex a bit.

[{'created': '2013-01-30 22:13:02.000000000', 'message': 'Removes assertGreaterEqual for Python 2.6 backward compat

The unittest.TestCase class in python 2.6.6 does not have
an assertGreaterEqual method. Changes the code to use
assertTrue instead to guarantee backward compatibility with
Python 2.6.

Fixes Bug 1108238.

Change-Id: Ifaba250d9d9813de913be322d18541cd2dbdf28e
'}]
commit_message:
Removes assertGreaterEqual for Python 2.6 backward compat

The unittest.TestCase class in python 2.6.6 does not have
an assertGreaterEqual method. Changes the code to use
assertTrue instead to guarantee backward compatibility with
Python 2.6.

Fixes Bug 1108238.

Change-Id: Ifaba250d9d9813de913be322d18541cd2dbdf28e

commit_message:
Testcase for keystone - List services

The list_services method creates the services, list services and
verify the newly created services and finally deletes all the
created services.

Change-Id: Ibcd6cb8c9ac19a10e5e9297811675ee711d86225
Implements: blueprint keystone-v3-service-api-test

commit_message:
Refactor libvirt volume driver classes to reduce duplication

Most of the libvirt volume driver class repeat the same setup
of the vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuestDisk() instance. Create a
more suitable base class to hold this common setup and simplify
all the other subclasses accordingly

Change-Id: I9a5a70ccf88a1e55cdb120c8c6d29e6847774691
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

Migrate from nose to testr.

Run tests with testr for parallel execution.

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools.

commit_message:
Fix the usage of password, keyrings, and tokens.

Fix how you keep on getting prompted for the password
all over the place and at the wrong time (the keyring code
should be used before a auth request, and not during).

Fix this by trying to use the token first (which comes from
the keyring module), then falling back to using the password
(which will get a token, and then store said token so that it
 isn't fetched again).

Change-Id: I58e69f3b3fbcc7a467797f25695b7ca59178a1d7

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-28 00:01:55.000000000', 'message': 'Use testr instead of nose

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools

Change-Id: I0b3f1bcb5d4ff59c65eb3219b30a9e64f54d70bd
'}, {'created': '2013-01-03 22:09:48.000000000', 'message': 'Use testr instead of nose

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools

Change-Id: I0b3f1bcb5d4ff59c65eb3219b30a9e64f54d70bd
'}, {'created': '2013-01-13 20:16:11.000000000', 'message': 'Use testr instead of nose.

nose is invasive and can sometimes alter the outcome of a test run. testr,
on the other hand, keeps a distinction between running tests and displaying
results of the test runs. Additionally, it supports the stock python unittest
protocol.

Even better, testr supports parallel test running, which makes things faster,
and a command "testr run --failing" which will just re-run the latest failing
tests (often something one wants to do in iterative dev)

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools

Change-Id: I0b3f1bcb5d4ff59c65eb3219b30a9e64f54d70bd
'}, {'created': '2013-01-18 21:16:12.000000000', 'message': 'Use testr instead of nose.

on the other hand, keeps a distinction between running tests and displaying
results of the test runs. Additionally, it supports the stock python unittest
protocol.

Even better, testr supports parallel test running, which makes things faster,
and a command "testr run --failing" which will just re-run the latest failing

commit_message:
Use testr instead of nose.

nose is invasive and can sometimes alter the outcome of a test run. testr,
on the other hand, keeps a distinction between running tests and displaying
results of the test runs. Additionally, it supports the stock python unittest
protocol.

Even better, testr supports parallel test running, which makes things faster,
and a command "testr run --failing" which will just re-run the latest failing
tests (often something one wants to do in iterative dev)

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools

Change-Id: I0b3f1bcb5d4ff59c65eb3219b30a9e64f54d70bd

My guess is that this will still fail, due to the removal of the nova.wsgi import; the failure will be a unit test failure, and the cause is a side effect of the nova.wsgi import: the importation of nova.db.  If my prediction is true, you have two options:

1) Add back the nova.wsgi import.  This should restore the branch to working status.  The improper reliance on the side effect of making nova.db available isn't really in the scope of your patch anyway.

2) My preference: Add an import for nova.db.  This should also restore the branch to working status, and is what this file should have done in the first place.

Also, I want to confirm that you are running the full test suite prior to pushing patches up for review.  The best way of running the test suite is to use "tox" ("pip install tox" to install it).  I personally use "tox -e py26,pep8", which causes the test suite to be run under Python 2.6 as well as running the pep8 and hacking tests.  (If you only have Python 2.7 installed, use "py27" instead of "py26".)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-30 15:15:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Merge all VIF classes into one LibvirtGenericVIFDriver

Complete the refactoring of VIF drivers by merging all their
functionality into one single LibvirtGenericVIFDriver and
conditionally call the appropriate code based on the 'vif_type'
parameter

All existing VIF drivers are made to inherit from the
LibvirtGenericVIFDriver and then directly call into a specific
impl, such that they retain functional equivalence with their
impl under Folsom. These are purely to ease migration to the
new impl during Grizzly deployments and will be removed
completely in the Hxxxxx release.

Blueprint: libvirt-vif-driver
Change-Id: I694c84ca7bb1666484bf144f808bcb33b95813fd
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Hardcode provision-finished file path

A recent change removed the use of the cloudinit module, so write this
log to /var/lib/heat. Functional test paths updated as well.
(User data injection was removed, so that has been deleted as well.)

Change-Id: Ibcaf310a5e4ff9a9ed8b1065bdd411e1b95d4de5
Signed-off-by: Jeff Peeler <jpeeler@redhat.com>

are there no pecan-level unit tests?'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-01-22 14:50:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

To run ceilometer you need runtime deps (pip-requires)
To run tests you need runtime deps (pip-requires)+ some tests deps (test-requires)

This is why we use the -r option twice for tests.

I don't see any value in copying the content of pip-requires into test-requires, if that's what you suggest. commit_message:
Ceilometer-api is crashing due to pecan module missing

Moving pecan module listing from test-requires
and test-requires-folsom to pip-requires so that
it can be used by both setup.py and tox.ini

Bug #1102614

Change-Id: I67cd45c068305ec7897d67b425b06173e092b9f8

commit_message:
Fix missing wrap_db_error for Session.execute() method

We should add wrap_db_error for Session.execute() method, because
Query.update() method will call Session.execute() and it is not inside
Session.flush(), so exceptions from Query.update() wouldn't be wrapped.

Add test for Session.flush() wrapper
Add test for Session.execute() wrapper

Fixes bug 1107890

Change-Id: I96894e502f9f279999b61a1e66469e34a07a022d

There is a specific filter (ReadFileFilter) that lets you specify which file you want to read, rather than blindly allowing "cat" to be run as root. You should use that instead. See read_initiator filter in compute.filters for an example.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2013-01-10 10:15:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

..except that ReadFileFilter only accepts an explicit path and you need to read files below an unpredictable $mountpoint. So it would need to be seriously improved to be used in this case. Sigh.

Grumble, I hate this password injection stuff. I can't wait until we get rid of it and close all the holes it opens."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2013-01-10 10:19:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

So my suggestion would be, instead of opening "cat" entirely, improve the ReadFileFilter so that it can support some glob wildcard. Alternatively, use a RegExpFilter instead of a CommandFilter...'}, {'account_id': 3068, 'date': '2013-01-10 10:49:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3068, 'date': '2013-01-10 10:55:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2013-01-21 09:41:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Note: Since compute.filters currently already allows unrestricted use of chown/chmod as root, it already lets the nova user read the content of any file owned by root, so there is no need to be too restrictive about this one. Basically, a CommandFilter allowing blind access to "cat" would give you same security in the end.

The real long-term solutions here are (1) get rid of all file-injection-as-root, (2) have all chmod/chown/cat use a PathFilter (see bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo/+bug/1098568)'}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-01-22 22:36:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

@ttx I'm not sure I agree. cat is traceless, chown / chmod change the datestamp of the file, so will leave traces behind, better than nothing."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2013-01-23 10:25:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Good point... Although the current (evil) compute.filters also allows unrestricted "dd" which is sufficient to access the content of a file without altering the original file :) My point is that on compute nodes the code allows the nova user to easily escalate to root via various mechanisms. We are still a long way from efficiently isolating nova from root on those specific nodes, which is the main reason behind the no-db-compute effort.'}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-01-25 21:16:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Thanks Arata.'}, {'account_id': 209, 'date': '2013-01-29 19:22:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Add rootwrap filters for password injection with localfs

Allow to 'sudo cat' to read passwd and shadow.

bug 1098077

Change-Id: Ic734bd33223df879b5e1f144bb4c85702eb88dfa

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-29 08:02:26.000000000', 'message': 'Fix boot with image not active

When boot with image which is not active, nova API response
with http status code 500. We should catch the exception and
raise HTTPBadRequest with more precise information.

Fix LP# 1108645

Change-Id: Ibd78f4b96bfdb925b03d7809d4e28afcc7e1ddcf
'}]
commit_message:
Fix boot with image not active

When boot with image which is not active, nova API response
with http status code 500. We should catch the exception and
raise HTTPBadRequest with more precise information.

Fix LP# 1108645

Change-Id: Ibd78f4b96bfdb925b03d7809d4e28afcc7e1ddcf

Don't warn up front about libvirt loading issues in NWFilterFirewall

libvirt module

@sean actually use of 'tap' has long been the recommended value for Xen and supported in pretty much every libvirt for past 7 years :-) Perhaps you were thinking of 'tap2' which is a much more recent feature addition.

'file' is an unsafe setting because it uses the loopback device which has no  guarantees about data sync to disk - as such it looses data on host crash that the guest OS thought was written. 'tap', 'tap2' and 'phy' are the only two values that should ever be used for Xen."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-01-21 22:14:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-14 13:23:38.000000000', 'message': 'Revert: use file instead of tap for non-blockdevice images on Xen

This patch reverts 35c4962c0b97bae5b8751d316d5822fe22c1ab6a: 'use
file instead of tap for non-blockdevice images on Xen', which breaks
qcow2 disk working on Xen. If the method pick_disk_driver_name()
returns 'file' for qcow2 format, we would get the following disk XML
snippet:

    <disk type="file" device="disk">
      <driver name="file" type="qcow2" cache="none"/>
      <source file="/data/instances/instance-00000081/disk"/>
      <target bus="xen" dev="hda"/>
    </disk>

which produces configuration in the xen tools like:

    "file:/data/instances/instance-00000081/disk,hda,w"

Guest would not boot successfully, as Xen doesn't think of disk format
as qcow2. Instead, 'tap' works with both raw and qcow2 disk.

For LP#1084618, I think it is related with libvirt verion. In my
deployment(libvirt-1.0.1), 'tap' dirver could produce correct
configuration for both raw and qcow2 disk format.

Change-Id: I636b2fed366474e2ae8c3b52403e3085724b24f0

commit_message:
libvirt: use tap for non-blockdevice images on Xen

This patch reverts 35c4962c0b97bae5b8751d316d5822fe22c1ab6a: 'use
file instead of tap for non-blockdevice images on Xen', which breaks
qcow2 disk working on Xen. If the method pick_disk_driver_name()
returns 'file' for qcow2 format, we would get the following disk XML
snippet:

    <disk type="file" device="disk">
      <driver name="file" type="qcow2" cache="none"/>
      <source file="/data/instances/instance-00000081/disk"/>
      <target bus="xen" dev="hda"/>
    </disk>

which produces configuration in the xen tools like:

    "file:/data/instances/instance-00000081/disk,hda,w"

Guest would not boot successfully, as Xen doesn't think of disk format
as qcow2. Instead, 'tap' works with both raw and qcow2 disk.

For LP#1084618, I think it is related with libvirt verion. In my
deployment(libvirt-1.0.1), 'tap' dirver could produce correct
configuration for both raw and qcow2 disk format.

commit_message:
Fix rendering of FixedIpNotFoundForNetworkHost

Fixes bug 1104000

With https://review.openstack.org/18319 a small bug was introduced. The
exception FixedIpNotFoundForNetworkHost is expecting network_id
parameter, and the change modified that parameter to network_uuid. This
patch fixes this problem at the raise point.

Change-Id: Idc0fa7fcba9ad37b73183f8811376c6c8adada68

commit_message:
Factorize agent code

There was some code duplication between the central and compute agent around
their managers, so let's factorize that.

Change-Id: I90514e7591833254145ceab366ad5a0d03d8f228
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
Remove warning for existing output directory.

In our configuration puppet will manage the output directory, so it
is expected behavior for it to exist, removing warning. Also
switching to distutils.dir_util copy_tree since that allows for
copying of required supporting files into an existing output
directory.

Change-Id: I38b2c6ec47fd61814554a4b5007a83553b05aeb2
Reviewed-on: https://review.openstack.org/20647
Approved: Dan Prince <dprince@redhat.com>
Reviewed-by: Dan Prince <dprince@redhat.com>
Tested-by: Jenkins

[{'created': '2013-01-30 16:39:43.000000000', 'message': 'Trying a RedirectMatch rather than a Redirect for the old install

commit_message:
Trying a reirect for the old install

This should redirect calls to an old version (before the OS split)
to the /yum/ version of the new install guide.

Need to do this to get rid of the old GA code and prevent it from sending
data, plus have readers get the latest install info.

Change-Id: I7d85bcd48b4760ab5f273872596c8df77a9e5bee

Explicit notes in README for running tests.

And fix up the docs for unit tests to support non-devstack environments.

This is a temporary fix until the Quantum patch lands. Then
devstack will be updated to remove all of the root_helper
settings in the DEFAULT section.
The Quantum patch in Question is:

Change-Id: Ie17ae76e8b525481e1002bd941812390cf2e2afc
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure that debug agent has root_helper in [AGENT] section

This is a temporary fix until the Quantum patch lands. Then
devstack will be updated to remove all of the root_helper
settings in the DEFAULT section.
The Quantum patch in Question is:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/20603/

Change-Id: Ie17ae76e8b525481e1002bd941812390cf2e2afc

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-11 21:44:05.000000000', 'message': 'Implement LVM thin provisioning support.

As of LVM2 version 2.02.89 the ability to do thin provisioning
was made available in LVM, this provides some cool new features
but also addresses some problems with things like terribel LVM
LVM snapshot performance.

Currently the version of LVM in Ubuntu 12.04 does NOT support LVM thin,
however an experimental PPA from brightbox which is a backport from
Quantal has been proposed to Cannonical to be pulled in.  For some
users the experimental PPA is a better option than dealing with some of
the current issues in the standard LVM2 version of Precise (including
the dd hangs on secure delete). See BP for more info.

Implements BP: implement-lvm-thin-provisioning

Change-Id: I8a30a1283e1992c64e8ac96841ae4a6f82f7018a
'}, {'created': '2013-01-12 21:00:01.000000000', 'message': 'Implement LVM thin provisioning support.

As of LVM2 version 2.02.89 the ability to do thin provisioning
was made available in LVM, this provides some cool new features
but also addresses some problems with things like terribel LVM
LVM snapshot performance.

Currently the version of LVM in Ubuntu 12.04 does NOT support LVM thin,
however an experimental PPA from brightbox which is a backport from
Quantal has been proposed to Cannonical to be pulled in.  For some
users the experimental PPA is a better option than dealing with some of
the current issues in the standard LVM2 version of Precise (including
the dd hangs on secure delete). See BP for more info.

This change will create the thin pool if DNE using pool_size flag,
or by default using entire VG space.

Implements BP: implement-lvm-thin-provisioning

Change-Id: I8a30a1283e1992c64e8ac96841ae4a6f82f7018a
'}, {'created': '2013-01-15 20:23:54.000000000', 'message': 'Implement LVM thin provisioning support.

commit_message:
Implement LVM thin provisioning support.

As of LVM2 version 2.02.89 the ability to do thin provisioning
was made available in LVM, this provides some cool new features
but also addresses some problems with things like terrible
LVM snapshot performance.

Currently the version of LVM in Ubuntu 12.04 does NOT support LVM thin,
however an experimental PPA from brightbox which is a backport from
Quantal has been proposed to Cannonical to be pulled in.  For some
users the experimental PPA is a better option than dealing with some of
the current issues in the standard LVM2 version of Precise (including
the dd hangs on secure delete). See BP for more info.

This change will create the thin pool if it doesn't exist
using pool_size flag, or by default using entire VG space.

Implements BP: implement-lvm-thin-provisioning

Change-Id: I8a30a1283e1992c64e8ac96841ae4a6f82f7018a

commit_message:
Pull cfg module from Oslo and update cinder-manage accordingly

New cfg module abandons previous disable_interspersed_args() and
recommand to use add_subparsers from argparser module instead.
This patch pull cfg module from Oslo and update the affected
cinder-manage utils.

Change-Id: I8913fafb8fdb19b3fe0a695a70c8b1e8f59c1027

commit_message:
xenapi: Add support for different image upload drivers

This change refactors image upload code for xenapi and adds the
xenapi_image_upload_handler config option.

Preparation for bp nova-direct-image-upload
DocImpact

Change-Id: Icd4e7ef135beddca9ddcc4a880c09e5a1702a93c

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-30 16:10:12.000000000', 'message': 'Fix eventlet/mysql db pooling code

Eventlet versions >= 0.10 return a tuple from
db_pool.ConnectionPool().create(), not a scalar.

Also, set the FOUND_ROWS client flag, which sqlalchemy
appears to require to sanity check the number of rows
touch.

bug 1097992

Change-Id: I64e798660c506fcd13947a232cb7832db0318360
'}]
commit_message:
Fix eventlet/mysql db pooling code

Eventlet versions >= 0.10 return a tuple from
db_pool.ConnectionPool().create(), not a scalar.

Also, set the FOUND_ROWS client flag, which sqlalchemy
appears to require to sanity check the number of rows
touch.

bug 1097992

Change-Id: I64e798660c506fcd13947a232cb7832db0318360

commit_message:
Pick just the first route when looking for the host interface

The current code will fail miserably if multiple default routes are
present (perfectly normal if they have different metrics). Fixing
the code to pick the first/top entry

Fixes LP# 1084470

Change-Id: Ieda16b575685071ff831c92e6b2a29737d6f849b

In Precise and Quantal, we nuke the dnsmasq launched by NetworkManager

Fixes LP# 993666

Abstract methods should throw NotImplementedError.

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/20588/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/28482 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/20588/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres/963 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/20588/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/3046 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-01-30 11:59:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

devstack really is living documentation, so I don't think changing the default install location is a good idea. We aren't trying to smooth out the differences between distros, but make it so people can understand how things would be installed if rolling from source.

If we think the location is wrong on Fedora, it's probably worth adjust setup.py in nova or something so it always installs to /usr/local/bin on Fedora, not just if we add our own flag."}, {'account_id': 6717, 'date': '2013-01-30 12:13:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I didn't like messing with install location either, which is why I initially proposed https://review.openstack.org/#/c/20126/ but dtroyer didn't like that particular implementation one and mmagr (previous bug owner) and ndipanov thought this one is better/fine.

I'm not sure what to do with this contradictionary feedback now ;)"}, {'account_id': 6717, 'date': '2013-01-30 15:31:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

Abandoning this in favor of improved original solution:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/20126/'}]

commit_message:
Install scripts to /usr/local/bin/ on Fedora.

Make setuptools install scripts to /usr/local/bin/ on Fedora instead of
default /usr/bin/. Other distributions use /usr/local/bin/ by default so
this unifies behavior and allowed removal of is_fedora check in
get_rootwrap_location().

Fixes: bug #1068386
Change-Id: Ifa7190d04dc0baed19f6965760502ed98f5e080a

Going to repost it - git review messed up my branch name because of the regex match on 'blueprint describes' above :)"}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2013-01-30 13:48:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

File Edit Options Buffers Tools YASnippet Help                                  
It seems the ovs_driver just hooks network/port creation.
So can notifier (or rpc call) be used? Thus it can be used for any ovs-based
plugins.

The driver API is defined, but not all methods are used. Is it under design?
What about live-migration support?

naming: probably ovs_driver is misleading. I think ovs plugin is just chosen
for first candidate.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-30 13:48:24.000000000', 'message': "Adds support to the OVSPlugin to interface with multi-vendor hardware
devices/management stations.

This blueprint describes a generic python API within the OVS quantum plugin
which will enable support for different hardware backends for L2 network
segregation (VLANs, tunneling, etc.)

This may be useful for existing data centers with hardware switches which needs
to be used along with Openstack infrastructure. In this case a hardware vendor
may introduce the OVS plugin extension which will allow using vendor's hardware
within Openstack along with Open vSwitch virtual switches to provide L2 network
segregation.

This will allow automatic L2 network provisioning on the hardware devices
alongside with the open vswitch provisioning in the compute node hypervisors.

We have implemented the API proposed in this blueprint and are providing the
source code for an Arista Driver which supports provisioning of Arista TOR
(top-of-the-rack) switches alongside with open vswitches. This driver will
support the python API proposed in this blueprint to interact with the OVS
quantum plugin.

Change-Id: I4a0a2e2d527a192862bf0b5022803e211bf7ec99
Implements: blueprint ovsplugin-hardware-devices
"}]
commit_message:
Adds support to the OVSPlugin to interface with multi-vendor hardware
devices/management stations.

This blueprint describes a generic python API within the OVS quantum plugin
which will enable support for different hardware backends for L2 network
segregation (VLANs, tunneling, etc.)

This may be useful for existing data centers with hardware switches which needs
to be used along with Openstack infrastructure. In this case a hardware vendor
may introduce the OVS plugin extension which will allow using vendor's hardware
within Openstack along with Open vSwitch virtual switches to provide L2 network
segregation.

This will allow automatic L2 network provisioning on the hardware devices
alongside with the open vswitch provisioning in the compute node hypervisors.

We have implemented the API proposed in this blueprint and are providing the
source code for an Arista Driver which supports provisioning of Arista TOR
(top-of-the-rack) switches alongside with open vswitches. This driver will
support the python API proposed in this blueprint to interact with the OVS
quantum plugin.

Change-Id: I4a0a2e2d527a192862bf0b5022803e211bf7ec99
Implements: blueprint ovsplugin-hardware-devices

[{'created': '2013-01-29 19:03:44.000000000', 'message': "heat engine : error on resource update with invalid properties

If properties validation fails, raise an error so the resource is
marked as UPDATE_FAILED, we don't want to go ahead and try running
handle_update anyway

Change-Id: I5f748b9de6a2b02d26421a5b6e0b1b5f0db25d0c
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
heat engine : error on resource update with invalid properties

If properties validation fails, raise an error so the resource is
marked as UPDATE_FAILED, we don't want to go ahead and try running
handle_update anyway

Change-Id: I5f748b9de6a2b02d26421a5b6e0b1b5f0db25d0c
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2013-01-19 01:55:21.000000000', 'message': "correct skip condition in test

the skip test with swift_connect would always fail if swift client
couldn't be connected to because self wasn't available. Fix so that
the intended behavior exists.

Found after doing some pyflakes sweeps since we got caught with
undefined name typos in a couple of places today.

Change-Id: I50cb8fdc03505e171066e8b0a0fdfe9146559933
"}]
commit_message:
correct skip condition in test

the skip test with swift_connect would always fail if swift client
couldn't be connected to because self wasn't available. Fix so that
the intended behavior exists.

Found after doing some pyflakes sweeps since we got caught with
undefined name typos in a couple of places today.

Change-Id: I50cb8fdc03505e171066e8b0a0fdfe9146559933

commit_message:
Invoke the has_more_data function of tables when loading TableTab.
This allows classes extending TableTab to support pagination.

Fixes bug 1108195.

Change-Id: I4331aa66f0686f9991eb56721564a12248411a1f

commit_message:
Add sudoers rule to format and mount anykind of partitions in disks.

The element vm is the only one creating a partition in the disk.
If not included, it will ask for sudo password to format or mount
the whole nbd disk or disks with multiple partitions.

Change-Id: Iac0987d2088433873b7cbb68deecc9254b2d0103

just default LANG to C. This settls Perl's noisy warnings and also stops

commit_message:
Switch locale to C

Remove the explicit installation of an English language pack and instead
just default LANG to C. This settls Perl's noisy warnings and also stops
any side effects of different language build hosts.

Note that this is set right at the start of the build process, so it
should be entirely possible to override if needs be.

Change-Id: Id3b31162d4198fa02dc5a4d11168e57dbcd14a5d

subject: Support running uninstalled in a tarball dir.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1247, 'name': 'Mark McLoughlin', 'email': 'markmc@redhat.com', 'username': 'markmc'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'email': 'fpercoco@redhat.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}]

[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-24 21:18:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

- http://logs.openstack.org/20431/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-docs/531 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/20431/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-python27/716 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-01-24 21:26:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-01-24 21:41:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-01-24 21:48:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Thanks Monty'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-01-25 13:42:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-01-28 09:51:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Something smells wrong about this

I don't see what's changed recently to affect this, so it looks like it's been the behaviour we've had for a while now

i.e. pkg_resources.get_provider is only going to know about a package if it's installed

When testing with e.g. tox, it gets installed into the venv before the tests are run

I also don't see why this is specific to tarballs - surely the same thing happens if you the tests from a git checkout

I'm not totally against making this work, but are we sure it's not standard practice to install first (or do e.g. python setup.py develop) ?"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-01-28 17:29:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I agree with Mark; this feels like an unusual case. Who is trying to work from uninstalled source? You have to install the dependencies before the tests will work anyway, right?"}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-01-29 00:39:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Specifically this happens in debian package builds. They run tests without running make install first as part of the build process. The streamlined code to pull from pkg_resources did not take that in to account.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-01-29 07:28:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Again, I'm not totally against doing this if someone can explain how this worked before if it's a regression and why it's just a problem with tarballs not git"}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-01-30 01:11:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It is a regression caused by the new re-working of how we process versions. Before, we were always producing versioninfo files. Now that we're just using the setup.py PKG_INFO metadata, it's not there to use. That's fine - it's a great optimization for the normal case - we just forgot about the case where debian runs test from a tarball checkout.

Also, it's would also be a problem in git checkouts without an install - but thusfar nobody has come up with a use case where we need to think about that, so I don't care. :)"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-30 07:10:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-01-30 07:10:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

(1 inline comment)

Ok, I've confirmed this is a regression - see the bug for details

That's good enough for me, thanks Monty"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-30 07:14:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/20431/1/gate/gate-oslo-incubator-docs/592 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/20431/1/gate/gate-oslo-incubator-pep8/777 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/20431/1/gate/gate-oslo-incubator-python26/777 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/20431/1/gate/gate-oslo-incubator-python27/777 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-30 07:14:41.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-24 21:14:22.000000000', 'message': 'Support running uninstalled in a tarball dir.

Running tests from the directory of an expanded tarball is a reasonable
thing to do, so support it by checking for PKG-INFO file if the pkg_resources
version grab fails.

Fixes bug 1103473

Change-Id: I2bf1fc39b070d3a2cdf6a3abe5e816c81d2916a0
'}]
commit_message:
Support running uninstalled in a tarball dir.

Running tests from the directory of an expanded tarball is a reasonable
thing to do, so support it by checking for PKG-INFO file if the pkg_resources
version grab fails.

Fixes bug 1103473

Change-Id: I2bf1fc39b070d3a2cdf6a3abe5e816c81d2916a0

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-14 08:53:23.000000000', 'message': 'Add capability to specify sqldb for Ceilometer

By default, ceilometer uses mongodb.
With the patch, sqldb can be specified to use for ceilometer.

In localrc, add a line:
        CEILOMETER_DATABASE_TYPE=mysql
or
        CEILOMETER_DATABASE_TYPE=postgresql

Change-Id: Ie4cdc9f3915dfaccb65436663345fcf31687db26
Signed-off-by: Shane Wang <shane.wang@intel.com>
'}, {'created': '2013-01-08 08:07:45.000000000', 'message': 'Add capability to specify sqldb for Ceilometer

By default, ceilometer uses mongodb.
With the patch, sqldb can be specified to use for ceilometer.

In localrc, add a line:
        CEILOMETER_DATABASE_TYPE=mysql
or
        CEILOMETER_DATABASE_TYPE=postgresql

Change-Id: Ie4cdc9f3915dfaccb65436663345fcf31687db26
Signed-off-by: Shane Wang <shane.wang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Add capability to specify sqldb for Ceilometer

By default, ceilometer uses mongodb.
With the patch, sqldb can be specified to use for ceilometer.

In localrc, add a line:
        CEILOMETER_DATABASE_TYPE=mysql
or
        CEILOMETER_DATABASE_TYPE=postgresql

Change-Id: Ie4cdc9f3915dfaccb65436663345fcf31687db26
Signed-off-by: Shane Wang <shane.wang@intel.com>
