commit_message:
Replace default service type with default providers

Bug 1102503

This patch simplifies service type management by removing the concept
of 'default service type', and the corresponding logic.

As a consequence, the specification of a default service type in
quantum.conf is not required anymore. For each advanced service however,
a default plugin/driver combination can be specified.

Change-Id: I0f390e280c692b19233fd7d609e246bcb1afc21f

commit_message:
Use proper kvm package for raring

Recently in raring kvm had become qemu-system, so the different
versions of Ubuntu will install the proper version of kvm.

Also removed duplicates from nova and baremetal as well.

Change-Id: I82310c6867d190f6c9a153991cedcef753608489
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Add python-keystoneclient dependency.

auth_token middleware which is used by wsgi pipline has moved to
python-keystoneclient, so add a dependency to pip-requires.
Fix bug #1103172

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-19 14:55:15.000000000', 'message': "rsyslogd restart cause infinite loop

Fixes lp bug #1076466

logging isn't setup to deal with multiple threads
- copying the appropriate code from swift sets it up for
  parallel operation (swift/common/utils.py)
If setup for syslog, logging cannot deal with rsyslogd
restart due to eventlet assuming it must retry indefinitely.
This adds a workaround to fix the problem which could be
removed if eventlet were fixed.
ref: https://lists.secondlife.com/pipermail/eventletdev/2012-September/001095.html

Change-Id: Iebe9d1c22f20070ace13ef0cf985582103522b40
"}, {'created': '2012-12-20 10:16:44.000000000', 'message': "rsyslogd restart cause infinite loop

Fixes lp bug #1076466

logging isn't setup to deal with multiple threads
- copying the appropriate code from swift sets it up for
  parallel operation (swift/common/utils.py)
If setup for syslog, logging cannot deal with rsyslogd
restart due to eventlet assuming it must retry indefinitely.
This adds a workaround to fix the problem which could be
removed if eventlet were fixed.
ref: https://lists.secondlife.com/pipermail/eventletdev/2012-September/001095.html

Change-Id: Iebe9d1c22f20070ace13ef0cf985582103522b40
"}]
commit_message:
rsyslogd restart cause infinite loop

Fixes lp bug #1076466

logging isn't setup to deal with multiple threads
- copying the appropriate code from swift sets it up for
  parallel operation (swift/common/utils.py)
If setup for syslog, logging cannot deal with rsyslogd
restart due to eventlet assuming it must retry indefinitely.
This adds a workaround to fix the problem which could be
removed if eventlet were fixed.
ref: https://lists.secondlife.com/pipermail/eventletdev/2012-September/001095.html

Change-Id: Iebe9d1c22f20070ace13ef0cf985582103522b40

commit_message:
Support to specify a database type for each project in devstack

By default, all projects use the same database specified by DATABASE_TYPE in
stackrc or `use_database` in localrc.
This patch is to extend this capability so each project can specify its own
database type (e.g. mysql, postgresql, ...). For example,

1) If nothing is changed, the default database mysql is used for all projects;
2) If there is a line in localrc
        use_database_default postgresql
   the default database is changed to postgresql for all projects;
3) If there is one more line in localrc
        NOVA_DATABASE_TYPE=mysql
   the database type for nova is mysql, but postgresql is still used for
   other projects.

This is also the prerequisite to specify sqldb for ceilometer.

Change-Id: I91c1c16bdc17ab86cda2b50e221097b22fe15f95
Signed-off-by: Shane Wang <shane.wang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Check for installed cinder in filter tests.

Some of the filter tests require that the cinder pkg is
installed on the system, specifically cinder.egg-info/entry_points.

This change check that the egg-info directory exists in the root
cinder directory and determines whether to skip or not.

Change-Id: I36145f170e802aed5dfae8eec4684e60ad3d6f2c

commit_message:
Remove DEFAULT_STACK_USER, just use STACK_USER

STACK_USER needs to be set for more than just stack.sh, there
was no real distinction for using DEFAULT_STACK_USER instead
of just setting STACK_USER directly in stackrc and allowing it
to be overridden in localrc.

Change-Id: I9e8d70db29bb421f1ce3dbf40a5ad299cc7ea785

[{'created': '2013-01-11 12:56:59.000000000', 'message': 'Handling rate-limit for JSON request- rest_client

Modified rest_client.py so as to re-try when request is rate-limited
with JSON as interface. The current logic in rest_client.py would not
re-try and directly raise "exceptions.OverLimit" once key 'overLimit' is
present in the response body. It does not see if the overLimit is due
to rate-limit. Hence checking if word "rate-limited" is present in the
response message.

Change-Id: I9dd3e2b4a117e8e905bf3f1ba8d108689e602297
Fixes: bug #1098540

commit_message:
Handling rate-limit for JSON request- rest_client

Modified rest_client.py so as to re-try when request is rate-limited
with JSON as interface. The current logic in rest_client.py would not
re-try and directly raise "exceptions.OverLimit" once key 'overLimit' is
present in the response body. It does not see if the overLimit is due
to rate-limit. Hence checking if word "rate-limited" is present in the
response message.

Change-Id: I9dd3e2b4a117e8e905bf3f1ba8d108689e602297
Fixes: bug #1098540

commit_message:
Addition of XML support to test_quotas.py

Added logic to test_quotas.py file so as to support XML calls.
Hence added exclusive client files for XML. Also modified JSON client
file, manager.py and clients.py according to new addition of
XML support.

Change-Id: Ibbdd87c2d1bb4e26ff0f77441dc91d71abc00d7f
Implements: blueprint add-xml-support

Postgresql does not allow sql that mix integer and booleans.
Switch to check if deleted flag is set to 0

commit_message:
Fix SQL Error with fixed ips under devstack/postgresql

Postgresql does not allow sql that mix integer and booleans.
Switch to check if deleted flag is set to 0

Fixes LP# 1109889

Change-Id: Icf03aa9591d398ba7d12f0db91e43df140e0df50

commit_message:
Fix typo in cinder/db/api.py

The api method quota_destroy_all_by_project() calls the implementation
quota_get_all_by_project()

Change-Id: I11927e1fd29c6248ce755dfd236bf0f9adf39d94
Fixes: bug #1108766

[{'created': '2013-01-22 03:58:21.000000000', 'message': 'Add check for RABBIT_HOST and RABBIT_PASSWORD in iniset_rpc_backend

In multi-node environment, RABBIT_HOST and RABBIT_PASSWORD are used to
indicate the server running rabbitmq service. We should check the
variables in iniset_rpc_backend.

Change-Id: Iaea8cc87315be91429a8747254310d6474930eec
'}]
commit_message:
Add check for RABBIT_HOST and RABBIT_PASSWORD in iniset_rpc_backend

In multi-node environment, RABBIT_HOST and RABBIT_PASSWORD are used to
indicate the server running rabbitmq service. We should check the
variables in iniset_rpc_backend.

Change-Id: Iaea8cc87315be91429a8747254310d6474930eec

commit_message:
Quantum root_helper update

We are currently moving root_helper to the [AGENT] section. This patch
is intended to enable the transition for that process.

Change-Id: Iff8144f74a1a5f8b0fc9af44bccf0213f4bfad7e

commit_message:
Renames old $devstack_dir to $TOP_DIR

This patch renames $devstack_dir which is no longer defined
to $TOP_DIR. Fixes problem where initialisation of ec2 images
for tempest testing was failing.

Change-Id: Ie0cd43209e58c903b1fe6cc528a4971896e6fab1

[{'created': '2013-01-28 20:34:15.000000000', 'message': 'Handle nested xtrace states

The lib/database abstraction includes the appropriate database file that also
contains the $XTRACE bits at entry and exit.  The nested XTRACE handling overwrote
the value from lib/database.  So...make the nested files use their own
XTRACE variables.

Change-Id: Ibdfc8d7d1e1457a9bc889b781ce176b417789ea1
'}]
commit_message:
Handle nested xtrace states

The lib/database abstraction includes the appropriate database file that also
contains the $XTRACE bits at entry and exit.  The nested XTRACE handling overwrote
the value from lib/database.  So...make the nested files use their own
XTRACE variables.

Change-Id: Ibdfc8d7d1e1457a9bc889b781ce176b417789ea1

For baremetal, IMHO, we really do need to get extra specs in the driver, and it should be preserved along with all the "normal" flavor info. This is related to review 11088.

commit_message:
Keep flavor information in system_metadata

This patch copies the instance_type information into an
instance's system_metadata on creation. This provides a way
for us to recall the attributes used to create the instance
even after the type may have been deleted.

This adds db migration 153, which generates flavor information in
system_metadata for existing instances in the database, as well as
brings a test to make sure that works.

Change-Id: Iad9d640b44df5f3831de58f9e800bcf42bc0610e

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-25 21:36:35.000000000', 'message': 'Use git protocol for cloning repos from github.com

* Change stackrc to use the git:// protocol when cloning from github.com.
  Github supports Basic Auth with the https:// protocol and this causes
  the stack.sh script to wait for the user to input a Github username
  and password. The git protocol does not try to authenticate so the
  stack.sh script can proceed uninterrupted.

Change-Id: Ia027886af69e36fd6f626931adfea635bc751c7d
Fixes: bug #1097984
'}, {'created': '2013-01-25 23:58:13.000000000', 'message': 'Use git protocol for cloning repos from github.com

* Change stackrc to use the git:// protocol when cloning from github.com.
  Github supports Basic Auth with the https:// protocol and this causes
  the stack.sh script to wait for the user to input a Github username
  and password. The git protocol does not try to authenticate so the
  stack.sh script can proceed uninterrupted.

Change-Id: Ia027886af69e36fd6f626931adfea635bc751c7d
Fixes: bug #1097984
'}, {'created': '2013-01-28 21:17:56.000000000', 'message': 'Update clone URL for noVNC

* Update noVNC to use https://github.com/kanaka/noVNC.git remote. The
  http://github.com/couldbuilders/noVNC.git repo is either no longer
  public or deleted now.

Change-Id: Ia027886af69e36fd6f626931adfea635bc751c7d
Fixes: bug #1097984
'}]
commit_message:
Update clone URL for noVNC

* Update noVNC to use https://github.com/kanaka/noVNC.git remote. The
  http://github.com/couldbuilders/noVNC.git repo is either no longer
  public or deleted now.

Change-Id: Ia027886af69e36fd6f626931adfea635bc751c7d
Fixes: bug #1097984

If the user doesn't specify a mask when creating a subnet, the mask
defaults to /32 (IPv4) or /128 (IPv6) making it impossible to allocate

commit_message:
Prevent the user from creating a single IP address sized network

If the user doesn't specify a mask when creating a subnet, the mask
defaults to /32 (IPv4) or /128 (IPv6) making it impossible to allocate
an IP address when later launching an instance. This patch prevents
creating a subnet with such a small mask.

Fixes bug #1102504

Change-Id: I4962e0a416b8ec9aca013e41783994f65c22a989

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-28 23:12:18.000000000', 'message': 'Nova Hyper-V driver refactoring

Blueprint: bp/bp/hyper-v-testing-serialization-improvements

This patchset contains a major refactoring of the Hyper-V driver.

The main reason for this refactoring is to provide proper component
abstraction and decoupling, thus replacing almost entirely the remaining
pre-Essex code previously available. This leads to a considerable
semplification of the testing framework, which is now entirely based on
stubs and mocks (mox), without any serialized stub / mock.

From an architectural perspective, the main driver class delegates
operations to "ops" classes (e.g. VMOps, VolumeOps, etc) which contain the
main logic and delegate OS specific actions to "utils" classes (e.g. VMUtils,
LiveMigrationUtils, etc) where the WMI and Win32 API OS specific code resides.

Additional attention has been put also into a better PEP8 code formatting,
including compliance with not mandatory checks like E121 through E128.

Change-Id: I900719c02b7c6b48d44ca68903813a1dcd023f9f

Blueprint: hyper-v-testing-serialization-improvements

This patchset contains a major refactoring of the Hyper-V driver.

The main reason for this refactoring is to provide proper component
abstraction and decoupling, thus replacing almost entirely the remaining
pre-Essex code previously available. This leads to a considerable
semplification of the testing framework, which is now entirely based on
stubs and mocks (mox), without any serialized stub / mock.

From an architectural perspective, the main driver class delegates
operations to "ops" classes (e.g. VMOps, VolumeOps, etc) which contain the
main logic and delegate OS specific actions to "utils" classes (e.g. VMUtils,
LiveMigrationUtils, etc) where the WMI and Win32 API OS specific code resides.

Additional attention has been put also into a better PEP8 code formatting,
including compliance with not mandatory checks like E121 through E128.

Change-Id: I900719c02b7c6b48d44ca68903813a1dcd023f9f

commit_message:
Nova Hyper-V driver refactoring

Blueprint: hyper-v-testing-serialization-improvements

This patchset contains a major refactoring of the Hyper-V driver.

The main reason for this refactoring is to provide proper component
abstraction and decoupling, thus replacing almost entirely the remaining
pre-Essex code previously available. This leads to a considerable
semplification of the testing framework, which is now entirely based on
stubs and mocks (mox), without any serialized stub / mock.

From an architectural perspective, the main driver class delegates
operations to "ops" classes (e.g. VMOps, VolumeOps, etc) which contain the
main logic and delegate OS specific actions to "utils" classes (e.g. VMUtils,
LiveMigrationUtils, etc) where the WMI and Win32 API OS specific code resides.

Additional attention has been put also into a better PEP8 code formatting,
including compliance with not mandatory checks like E121 through E128.

Change-Id: I900719c02b7c6b48d44ca68903813a1dcd023f9f

commit_message:
Take region_name into account when calling url_for

Fixes bug 1103282

When creating a Client object with region_name specified, url_for
will return an endpoint url for that region.

Change-Id: Ia5c95503fe2ed5e53de93040d70ba08a9c09f286

commit_message:
Move task_log functions to conductor

This moves the use of the following functions in compute/utils to
the conductor:

  task_log_get()
  task_log_begin_task()
  task_log_end_task()

This removes the db import from compute/utils.py

Related to blueprint no-db-compute

Change-Id: I6ed0563969afee78d9f2970308bc7f91e5690159

Looks like multi-region setups need the region name

Fixes LP# 1081037

DocImpact

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-25 14:34:28.000000000', 'message': "Update to requests>=1.0.0 for keystoneclient.

The requests module dropped all configuration with the 1.0.0 release.
There's no danger_mode and no 'verbose'' mode. The former shouldn't
be necessary anymore and the latter can be done by setting a different
log handler for the request.logging root logger.

Related to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/20127/

Change-Id: Ide43a41b5481daede96e142d1a4f6519e33c21bf
"}]
commit_message:
Update to requests>=1.0.0 for keystoneclient.

The requests module dropped all configuration with the 1.0.0 release.
There's no danger_mode and no 'verbose'' mode. The former shouldn't
be necessary anymore and the latter can be done by setting a different
log handler for the request.logging root logger.

Related to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/20127/

Change-Id: Ide43a41b5481daede96e142d1a4f6519e33c21bf

commit_message:
Store instance resource-id earlier

If creation is interrupted during startup, we will need the ID of the
instance stored in order to delete it later.

bug 1072932

Change-Id: I56b8d285bba43d6e2466705956f85c06f119d65c
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

I think this check needs to go into the authorize() and authorize_anonymous() methods. Otherwise, if additional middleware is used in conjunction with keystone (eg tempauth), that middleware may override the allowed OPTIONS request (eg tempauth will default-deny all requests that don't already have an authorize callback set)."}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-01-21 22:44:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress

after a chat with john on irc i may need to rework this further:

23:40 notmyname: chmouel: OPTIONS is a valid request for non-CORS too. it responds with what you can ask of the resource (eg allowed verbs)
23:40 notmyname: chmouel: and CORS can be done in an authorized way, too (see the current CORS patch to see a JS example of doing this)
23:41 notmyname: chmouel: but the point is that you can make the authz decision in the __call__ without also setting an authorize handler because other auth middleware (eg tempauth, swauth, cs_auth, swiftstack auth) will default to a deny-if-nothing-is-set policy'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-01-21 22:57:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

commit_message:
Fix OVSQuantumAgent.port_update if not admin_state_up

self.agent does not exist. Use self.plugin_rpc, not
self.agent.plugin_rpc.

Change-Id: Id472c07f5a16891c040cc1afdcb457e1ef81beed

As a general point, it is really bad practice to lump together all these distinct changes in one commit. Each one of these:

. Launch OVF disk image
. VNC console
. Attach and Detach iSCSI volume
. Guest info
. Host ops
. VLAN & Quantum integration

should be done in its own isolated GIT commit. For further guidance on why this is important see

http://wiki.openstack.org/GitCommitMessages#Structural_split_of_changes'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-12-06 10:53:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Fix floating ips with external gateway

If dnsmasq is configured to use an external gateway, then floating
ips on other interfaces do not work properly. This is because
outgoing traffic is no longer snatted to the floating ip.

This patch fixes it by adding an ebtables rule to force traffic
from ips that have a floating ip associated to route instead
of bridge.

Fixes bug 1096985

Change-Id: I8e4904660d42fe51c44b66686bed9f5d622693bd

commit_message:
Add version constraint for cinder

Cinder client usage requires the "retries" parameter introduced in
cinderclient-1.0.1. This should be a constraint in pip-requires.

Change-Id: I36e8a363c9d4bb7cc4ecfda85644fc4284f17471

commit_message:
_sync_compute_node should log host and nodename

ResourceTracker:_sync_compute_node logs the host name when it
creates or updates the record for a compute node. However, with
baremetal, one compute_node (host) may actually manage many
separate physical nodes, identified by unique nodenames.

This patch updates the LOG.info calls to include the nodename.

Change-Id: I69c66b84394b2a740a7ca9d2781015a7e1ff9998

commit_message:
Initial support for Transifex translations

Adds initial message extract and configuration to allow heat
to work with Transifex, which is the chosen platform for
translations in OpenStack.

Fixes bug #1082805

Change-Id: If8585812d6127948f75994765d274da1629069a3

Add tests to prohibit this error from happening again.

Resolves bug 1107156.

Change-Id: I6d6a6ba44d38d363489853d0407ad4cc94046656
'}, {'created': '2013-01-28 10:00:50.000000000', 'message': 'Fix an error in affinity filters

Fix a call to compute_api.get_all to properly exclude deleted instances.
Add tests to prohibit this error in the future.

After some thought, this can be further optimized to let the instance
query do all the filtering/matching.

Resolves bug 1107156.

Change-Id: I6d6a6ba44d38d363489853d0407ad4cc94046656
'}]
commit_message:
Fix an error in affinity filters

Fix a call to compute_api.get_all to properly exclude deleted instances.
Add tests to prohibit this error in the future.

After some thought, this can be further optimized to let the instance
query do all the filtering/matching.

Resolves bug 1107156.

Change-Id: I6d6a6ba44d38d363489853d0407ad4cc94046656

in """ rather than '''. bin/nova-{novncproxy,spicehtml5proxy}
were exceptions to this.

'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-25 23:51:45.000000000', 'message': '_get_secgroup returns first group even if multiple groups match

Nova's security group api layer ensures that a given tenant is not able to
create multiple security groups with the same name. That said, if one is the
admin user and does:
"nova secgroup-delete <secgroup that has a duplicate name as another tenant>"
The first security group that is returned with that name will be removed,
which might not have been what the user intended to do. In addition, quantum
allows multiple security groups to be created with the same name therefore
this change is needed to ensure the correct behavior when nova has a quantum
security group proxy.

Fixes bug 1105542

Change-Id: I99734355026e2ad18056c2f4180b5740fda8775a
'}, {'created': '2013-01-26 02:11:52.000000000', 'message': '_get_secgroup returns first group even if multiple groups match

which might not have been what the user intended to do. In addition, quantum
allows multiple security groups to be created with the same name therefore

Fixes bug 1105542

Change-Id: I99734355026e2ad18056c2f4180b5740fda8775a
'}]
commit_message:
_get_secgroup returns first group even if multiple groups match

Nova's security group api layer ensures that a given tenant is not able to
create multiple security groups with the same name. That said, if one is the
admin user and does:
"nova secgroup-delete <secgroup that has a duplicate name as another tenant>"
The first security group that is returned with that name will be removed,
which might not have been what the user intended to do. In addition, quantum
allows multiple security groups to be created with the same name therefore
this change is needed to ensure the correct behavior when nova has a quantum
security group proxy.

Fixes bug 1105542

Change-Id: I99734355026e2ad18056c2f4180b5740fda8775a

commit_message:
Adds baremetal nova API support

This implements the various REST API calls that BareMetal adds to Nova.
(The nova API is implemented in review 19077)

Change-Id: I187862e9aa5dea41a7edf716aa75cc3d9982fbc8

'}, {'account_id': 5652, 'date': '2013-01-02 17:42:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

Should is_uuid_like support str uuids containing '-' characters?"}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-01-03 17:24:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Well, one, we don't seem to be validating tenant IDs anywhere else.  Two, this code looks very similar to (but not the same as) the is_uuid_like() in oslo-incubator, which may reflect a deliberate decision to disallow '-' in the name.  I think I need more convincing that this is a legitimate way of testing the tenant ID field…"}, {'account_id': 5586, 'date': '2013-01-06 09:30:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

one, like Kevin L. Mitchel said, we don't seem to be validating tenant IDs anywhere else. So I am not sure this is necessary. Two, if it's necessary, I think the validation also need ensure the tenant with this ID exists, rather than just validating the ID format."}, {'account_id': 6348, 'date': '2013-01-07 00:16:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 6348, 'date': '2013-01-07 00:35:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

One, I think it's necessary to validate the format of the UUID and especially the UUID with '-'.Because if not,the id like "a0eebc999c0b4ef8bb6d6bb9bd380a11" and "a0eebc99-9c0b-4ef8-bb6d-6bb9bd380a11" will be considered as the different ones when the "nova quota-update" command is executed.
Two, I also think whether the tenant exists or not should be validated, and it will be modified later.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-01-09 22:15:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (3 inline comments)

I like the direction of this patch.  Can we use the same logic for other cases where tenant_id is passed into a command.

Also I think checking if tenant_id is uuid and not checking if it valid in keystone is better than no check at all.'}, {'account_id': 6348, 'date': '2013-01-10 03:39:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 6348, 'date': '2013-01-10 04:01:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

The tenant_ids in the keystone database are all made of numbers and lower characters, and doesn't contain '-'.
I think all the uuids should be in the same format, so what about controlling them in the format of tenant_id."}, {'account_id': 6348, 'date': '2013-01-10 10:22:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6348, 'date': '2013-01-10 10:30:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Check tenant_id's format in "nova quota-update"

Fix bug 1088835
"nova quota-update" command is executed without checking the format of
the tenant_id argument. The tenant_id should be in the format of UUID.
The tenant_id of quotas should be in accord with the form of keystone's
tenant_id. So this patch checks the format of the tenant_id when "nova
quota-update" command is executed.

Change-Id: I47c4f2ff9adbab5da4697270dcf024ac88e24529

commit_message:
ClientExceptions should include url and method

Fixes Bug 1103557.
novaclient abstracts out http request from user/client
making it unknown to user what root cause behind nova client
exceptions being raised. By including url and method in exception
handling, this allows user to handle accordingly.

Change-Id: I1a509bb932b3fd029bd0870ab699a39e21da19bb

commit_message:
RateLimit does not have method attribute

Fixes Bug #1103220.
RateLimit class raises Exceptions anytime __repr__
is called because cls does not have method attribute.

Change-Id: I7db2e1a3afddaae18d006e0cc884e9910afb8eaf

commit_message:
Updated doc support for Hosts API

Modified file: src/wadls/compute-api/src/ext/os-hosts.wadl
Linked the new samples located in the api_samples folder.
Also removed the optional att from the "status" and "maintenance_mode" params
since not providing them will cause an error.

subject: make print_dict split strings with newlines into multiple rows
messages:
[{'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2013-01-17 00:57:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This might be a controversial change but I wanted to propose it in case it might help others. It could break code that relies on the format of printed dicts etc.

I found in using nova show myself that as an admin, the instance fault details includes a backtrace that spanned the width of the terminal as one long line, causing the table to be unreadable.

I chose to update print_dict only because 1) it was the only place I faced the problem 2) it was the most clear how to handle long lines, print it over multiple rows, first row containing the key and empty key for the rest. For print_list, would have to decide what to do, make a new row with every other field empty until the long field is all printed? So I left that alone.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-17 01:13:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/19879/1/check/gate-python-novaclient-docs/543 : SUCCESS

'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-01-17 16:48:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

I understand your reasoning, and this is certainly one way to approach the problem; however, I wonder if, at least in the case of stack traces, the thing to do might be to split the trace on newline characters.  Also, see inline about length limits…'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2013-01-18 02:35:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

Makes sense. Trying a second patch where split on newlines first, then wrap if still too long (which I found is true for the stack traces, each line is longer than 80 characters).

In my testing the newlines are there in the stack trace string as literal r'\n' so that's how I'm splitting it."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2013-01-18 02:40:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-18 03:19:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
make print_dict split strings with newlines into multiple rows

When printing a dict e.g. "nova show" one of the properties
is "fault". When the user is admin, "details" of the fault
is shown, which includes a backtrace. This causes the
printing of the table to be unreadable as the backtrace
overflows the table row. This patch adds a separate row
for each substring after splitting on newlines.

Change-Id: I4c1bc8725a2bb6970be2c884c5e044d9eade8302

commit_message:
Allow for image selection using the metadata properties.

Instead of forcing users to remember a image name and/or uuid
instead allow them to specify a image metadata property to 'key'
off of.

For example:

I want to boot a image of ubuntu. This could now be a property
set in the image metadata and the following could be used to
find said image.

$ nova boot my-vm --image-with type=ubuntu

Now that user does not need to care what ubuntu version is being
selected or what the uuid is or what the image name is, they just
know that some image with ubuntu will likely get selected.

Change-Id: Ifaf71e282b8411d2e303cb52fd2623f6cf0bf32a

commit_message:
Allow request timeout to be specified.

Add a new cli argument (--timeout) which
is by default 600 seconds which will be
set in the requests library so that timeouts
can occur correctly.

Change-Id: I716ac15fe08f42c9464ee43010bc8fd2667bcbde

commit_message:
Tenant to Project in Back ends

A continuation of the process to convert the term tenant
to project.  These changes should only be visible in the
error messages produced, but should otherwise be
undetectable by calling programs.

Removes the TenantNotFound exception which propagates changes through
the code that calls the backends as well

Change-Id: I998a44bfd6aa85f67d58904bd7af25a56c73d48a

commit_message:
Remove Swift location/password from messages.

Updates several exceptions and log messages in the Swift backend
so that they don't include Swift location URI's which may contain
passwords when used in Swift single tenant mode.

Fixes LP Bug #1098962 (for Essex).

Change-Id: I71c0e953cff959890d759ae07574e8b436636279

commit_message:
Remove Swift location/password from messages.

Updates several exceptions and log messages in the Swift backend
so that they don't include Swift location URI's which may contain
passwords when used in Swift single tenant mode.

Fixes LP Bug #1098962.

Change-Id: I458de58563343347d5c976fe1ad084cc7e3280eb

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-29 15:05:05.000000000', 'message': "disallow boot from volume from specifying arbitrary volumes

Fix a vulnerability in volume attachment in nova-volume, affecting the
boot-from-volume feature.  By passing a specific volume ID, an
authenticated user may be able to boot from a volume they don't own,
potentially resulting in full access to that 3rd-party volume.
Folsom setups making use of Cinder are not affected.

Fixes bug: 1069904, CVE-2013-0208
Change-Id: I5f7c8d20d3ebf33ce1ce64bf0a8418bd2b5a6411
"}]
commit_message:
disallow boot from volume from specifying arbitrary volumes

Fix a vulnerability in volume attachment in nova-volume, affecting the
boot-from-volume feature.  By passing a specific volume ID, an
authenticated user may be able to boot from a volume they don't own,
potentially resulting in full access to that 3rd-party volume.
Folsom setups making use of Cinder are not affected.

Fixes bug: 1069904, CVE-2013-0208
Change-Id: I5f7c8d20d3ebf33ce1ce64bf0a8418bd2b5a6411

commit_message:
Update TEMPEST_README.txt

Change I4bf4a02890a33c4034e4493d1763ed4019fdf46e introduced
using a venv to tempest for running the tests. However,
etc/TEMPEST_README.txt still listed it as a TODO. This
updates the readme with the new behavior.

Change-Id: I730b53996f2785b09f02d014f71e6b97d1e20e75

commit_message:
Add instance_fault_create() to conductor

This moves the use of db.instance_fault_create() from the compute
utils to conductor.

Related to blueprint no-db-compute

Change-Id: If089ce1623374a259a2d63a99befc46fa3a130b6

commit_message:
Finer access control in os-volume_attachments

Allows policy.json access controls to authorize requests for specific
actions, rather than just being an all or nothing control for the entire
extension.

Bug 1108222
DocImpact
Change-Id: I78e1f596f22434a73bec3952ed024e4d58faac51

Finish adding help strings to all config options in Quantum code.

This adds reasonable help strings to all remaining config options
in Quantum code. This includes all the plugins as well.

Fixes bug 1101356

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-29 15:06:21.000000000', 'message': "disallow boot from volume from specifying arbitrary volumes

Fix a vulnerability in volume attachment in nova-volume, affecting the
boot-from-volume feature.  By passing a specific volume ID, an
authenticated user may be able to boot from a volume they don't own,
potentially resulting in full access to that 3rd-party volume.

Fixes bug: 1069904, CVE-2013-0208
Change-Id: I5f7c8d20d3ebf33ce1ce64bf0a8418bd2b5a6411
"}]
commit_message:
disallow boot from volume from specifying arbitrary volumes

Fix a vulnerability in volume attachment in nova-volume, affecting the
boot-from-volume feature.  By passing a specific volume ID, an
authenticated user may be able to boot from a volume they don't own,
potentially resulting in full access to that 3rd-party volume.

Fixes bug: 1069904, CVE-2013-0208
Change-Id: I5f7c8d20d3ebf33ce1ce64bf0a8418bd2b5a6411

validate specified volumes to boot from at the API layer

This causes the create to fail fast instead of putting
the instance into error later in the process.

Related to bug: 1069904

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-25 11:00:00.000000000', 'message': 'Replace class variable with instance variable

Currently the pollster stub in compute manager test case keeps
information in class variable, this will cause issue
when multiple test cases want to check such information because
class variable is not cleaned among different test cases execution.

Change it to instance variable to isolate different test cases.

Change-Id: I72f70da7018a9b44c32b7c41061b6bd21ee3f103
Signed-off-by: Yunhong, Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>
'}, {'created': '2013-01-29 12:38:52.000000000', 'message': 'Clean class variable in compute manager test case

Currently the pollster stub in compute manager test case keeps
information in class variable and does not clean it.
When multiple test cases want to check such information, it will fail
because class variable is not cleaned among different test cases
execution.

Add tearDown method to clean it up.

Change-Id: I72f70da7018a9b44c32b7c41061b6bd21ee3f103
Signed-off-by: Yunhong, Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Clean class variable in compute manager test case

Currently the pollster stub in compute manager test case keeps
information in class variable and does not clean it.
When multiple test cases want to check such information, it will fail
because class variable is not cleaned among different test cases
execution.

Add tearDown method to clean it up.

Change-Id: I72f70da7018a9b44c32b7c41061b6bd21ee3f103
Signed-off-by: Yunhong, Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Remove Swift location/password from messages.

Updates several exceptions and log messages in the Swift backend
so that they don't include Swift location URI's which may contain
passwords when used in Swift single tenant mode.

Fixes LP Bug #1098962 (for Folsom).

Change-Id: Ia97a95ce6ed5d98a76515eea8817e309bcf0889a

commit_message:
refactored data upgrade tests in test_migrations

The one off testing in test_migrations was starting to get obtuse
enough that it was possible for bugs to slip through (which they
did already). Create a more general framework for testing data
transitions at any db migration.

Hook the walk_versions code so as we are about to upgrade to a
migration point, attempt to run a _prerun_### function, then follow
it up with a _check_### function afterwards. Create some utility
functions to make doing things in these _prerun and _check functions
pretty concise.

This makes these checks db independent, and has it so they'll run
however we are running the walk_versions.

In doing so, this uncovered a bug in the 147 migration, which is
fixed inline. There is no retroactive fix, as 147 was destructive to
data, so would have nuked anyone that hit it already.

Updated to remove safe_getattr, thanks to jerdfelt for pointer on
doing that right.

Partially implements blueprint migration-testing-with-data

Fixes bug #1108448

Change-Id: I8bd92e3688109bfbdf1da21a175055b7263abf45

commit_message:
rootwrap: Avoid PEP8 errors on name replacement

Avoid triggering PEP8 errors when "oslo" is replaced by the project
name in oslo-rootwrap. Made necessary by "cinder", but tested
compatible with "ceilometer".

Change-Id: I9a1e25ec58e8b1e833c00f6cbb2083f967cbef76

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-22 15:22:22.000000000', 'message': "Merge LibvirtBridgeDriver class into LibvirtGenericVIFDriver

This introduces the LibvirtGenericVIFDriver class which uses
the 'vif_type' mapping field to determine what type of host
network configuration is required.

The LibvirtBridgeDriver class functionality is merged into
LibvirtGenericVIFDriver. For backwards compatibility with
the Folsom release, the existing LibvirtBridgeDriver class
is made to inherit from LibvirtGenericVIFDriver and directly
call the bridge specific setup APIs. This eases migration to
the new VIF impl during the Grizzly deployment lifecycle, with
an expectation that the LibvirtBridgeDriver stub will be
deleted in the Hxxxxx release.

Blueprint: libvirt-vif-driver
Change-Id: I948158b5ee0a97f666bb4d21020b552d3475b6d3
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2013-01-23 19:55:19.000000000', 'message': "Merge LibvirtBridgeDriver class into LibvirtGenericVIFDriver

commit_message:
Merge LibvirtBridgeDriver class into LibvirtGenericVIFDriver

This introduces the LibvirtGenericVIFDriver class which uses
the 'vif_type' mapping field to determine what type of host
network configuration is required.

The LibvirtBridgeDriver class functionality is merged into
LibvirtGenericVIFDriver. For backwards compatibility with
the Folsom release, the existing LibvirtBridgeDriver class
is made to inherit from LibvirtGenericVIFDriver and directly
call the bridge specific setup APIs. This eases migration to
the new VIF impl during the Grizzly deployment lifecycle, with
an expectation that the LibvirtBridgeDriver stub will be
deleted in the Hxxxxx release.

DocImpact
Blueprint: libvirt-vif-driver
Change-Id: I948158b5ee0a97f666bb4d21020b552d3475b6d3
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

'}, {'account_id': 518, 'date': '2013-01-23 14:52:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

First of all, I'd like to see some tests for this. That would probably make it clearer why this fails to begin with.

I haven't actually observed this problem, but I'm going to guess that the problem is that since the input (i.e the output from iptables-save) doesn't have the expected "*<table>" and "COMMIT" lines for the given tables (since it doesn't include said tables at all), the output also doesn't, so there are a bunch of orphan rules that iptables-restore doesn't know how to handle.

If that's indeed the case, I think a better fix would be to have _modify_rules always add them and not pass through the existing ones (if any). Adding fake table entries before passing the output would make more sense if we were trying to trick someone else's code into thinking they were there all along.'}, {'account_id': 1726, 'date': '2013-01-23 16:14:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Here is a quick test: http://paste.openstack.org/show/29751/

After removing the iptable_mangle module, the output from iptables-save doesn't include any reference to it, and nova-api breaks. As you can see on the command that is trying to execute, the first to rules, are out of place and with n reference table.

Working on moving the change to _modify_rules, I can't see a way to get the table name from the table object, so I have to pass it on the call."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-01-23 16:26:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

When do you see this error when running in production?  the bug report is scarce on details.

Also, can you add some unit tests to cover this."}, {'account_id': 1726, 'date': '2013-01-24 08:44:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-24 09:13:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
iptables-restore error when table not loaded.

When adding openstack rules, if a table module is not loaded,
the resulted file doesn't include the section for the missing
table, making new rules added to it, out of place and
a no valid file for iptables-restore

Fixes bug #1103436

Change-Id: I34ae51a23efec57bfec37b8fa378d043fcf62d70

commit_message:
Stop including full service catalog in each RPC msg

The service catalog is included in the context to get the cinder API
endpoints.  Instead of passing entire service catalog just for cinder
endpoint, just include cinder endpoint in context.service_catalog

Change-Id: Ic39173f0a2f330dbd78daa786b269f29ac4abf33

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-28 10:29:45.000000000', 'message': 'Use pypi for python-swiftclient dependency.

Using github as a package source is less reliable in the Jenkins test
framework than using pypi. This is because the Jenkins test framework
has a local pypi mirror.

Change-Id: Ia904d39ce70f5c2bd7d6edb9172f8226131074e2
'}]
commit_message:
Use pypi for python-swiftclient dependency.

Using github as a package source is less reliable in the Jenkins test
framework than using pypi. This is because the Jenkins test framework
has a local pypi mirror.

Change-Id: Ia904d39ce70f5c2bd7d6edb9172f8226131074e2

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-28 23:33:55.000000000', 'message': "Default lockutils to using a tempdir

* Previously lockutils attempted to use __file__/../ as the lock path.
  This causes packages to fail if the user running the code doesn't have
  +w access to that dir. Remove the default so it will use mkdtemp
  instead
* Fixes bug 1107950

Change-Id: Ie0cd6fac5403a53a768eb4a0ce7da602b3fef755
"}]
commit_message:
Default lockutils to using a tempdir

* Previously lockutils attempted to use __file__/../ as the lock path.
  This causes packages to fail if the user running the code doesn't have
  +w access to that dir. Remove the default so it will use mkdtemp
  instead
* Fixes bug 1107950

Change-Id: Ie0cd6fac5403a53a768eb4a0ce7da602b3fef755

commit_message:
Move from nose to testr.

Granted - this takes the test suite from 3 seconds to 1 second... but there
are a bunch of other ways (correctness) that testr is better than nose.

Removed tests/v1/utils - it was not being used anywhere.

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools.

Change-Id: I54d9a0b7dc22305ec60d779d6f19025a0b5dc785

unit tests either.

commit_message:
Add a volume driver for ZFS-on-Linux based SAN

This volume driver uses the SAN logics, ie. it generally connects and run
commands on the Linux ZFS host by SSH, so it does require the OpenStack
Cinder to run on this later.

It uses ZFS-on-Linux to provide the block-level volumes, ans the
standard Linux iSCSI layer to export it to the compute nodes.

This simple implementation does not provide support for
copy_image_to_volume and copy_volume_to_image yet, and there are no speficic
unit tests either.

Implement bp: zfsonlinux-volume-driver

Change-Id: Idc5e497802a07d166ea76029abea36192adec857

commit_message:
Remove some setup.py cruft.

We use testr now, and nose.collector in setup.py has never worked and has never
been used for anything. Also, setuptools_git in setup_requires is bogus - it's
only needed for making tarballs - it's not needed to consume them. Add our old
MANIFEST.in back for ease of operation for folks who don't have setuptools_git
installed... we'll stil use it in the infrastructure so that the dist tarballs
we cut will be solid, but it seems to be making life harder for some other
folks.

While we're at it, sort pip-requires to make looking at it easier.

Change-Id: Ic0dca27c02988c5e01f3e0f97ad0f2f14307bb6d

commit_message:
Add test for authentication with invalid token.

Space in the token when listing servers lead to HTTP 500. The correct
behaviour would IMHO be to result in HTTP 401 or 403. This is adding
tests using some invalid tokens.

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=866451
https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/974319

Change-Id: Iafbed7188b29cd620913787e9f89f7e2e8f67361

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-27 03:03:13.000000000', 'message': 'Fix XML schema validation failures

With this patch, running the tools/validate.py script will return
no DocBook RelaxNG schema validation failures.

There were three XML validation failures that were addressed

openstack-compute-admin/rootwrap.xml:

rootwrap.xml had to xml:id values that were the same. These have
been changed so they are different. It turns out this file was not
being included in the documentation at all. I submitted a separate
patch to include it: https://review.openstack.org/20551

openstack-compute-admin/computeconfigure.xml:

computeconfigure.xml had xi:include elements with an 'os' attribute.
This violates the spec, and it doesn't work, either. We had two
lines that looked like this:

<xi:include os="ubuntu" ...>
<xi:include os="rhel;fedora;centos" ...>

and both files were being included in the docs. This was changed so
that only one file is included, and there's a note that has been
added that describes the difference between the two files, which
is very minor (just one parameter).

openstack-ha/ha-guide-docinfo.xml:

This isn't a real XML file, it's a fragment of XML that is used
by a non-standard toolchain. The validation script has been configured
to just ignore it for now.

Change-Id: Ie77218efc56c16b7bf162f5e02fd7a6d99116dc1
'}, {'created': '2013-01-27 03:04:08.000000000', 'message': 'Fix XML schema validation failures

With this patch, running the tools/validate.py script will return
no DocBook RelaxNG schema validation failures.

Once this patch lands, and the equivalent lands in stable/folsom,
I will follow up on getting this run automatically by Jenkins so
we can see the results when there are new doc patch proposals.

There were three XML validation failures that were addressed

openstack-compute-admin/rootwrap.xml:

rootwrap.xml had to xml:id values that were the same. These have
been changed so they are different. It turns out this file was not
being included in the documentation at all. I submitted a separate
patch to include it: https://review.openstack.org/20551

openstack-compute-admin/computeconfigure.xml:

computeconfigure.xml had xi:include elements with an 'os' attribute.
This violates the spec, and it doesn't work, either. We had two
lines that looked like this:

<xi:include os="ubuntu" ...>
<xi:include os="rhel;fedora;centos" ...>

and both files were being included in the docs. This was changed so
that only one file is included, and there's a note that has been
added that describes the difference between the two files, which
is very minor (just one parameter).

openstack-ha/ha-guide-docinfo.xml:

This isn't a real XML file, it's a fragment of XML that is used
by a non-standard toolchain. The validation script has been configured
to just ignore it for now.

Change-Id: Ie77218efc56c16b7bf162f5e02fd7a6d99116dc1
'}]
commit_message:
Fix XML schema validation failures

With this patch, running the tools/validate.py script will return
no DocBook RelaxNG schema validation failures.

Once this patch lands, and the equivalent lands in stable/folsom,
I will follow up on getting this run automatically by Jenkins so
we can see the results when there are new doc patch proposals.

There were three XML validation failures that were addressed

openstack-compute-admin/rootwrap.xml:

rootwrap.xml had to xml:id values that were the same. These have
been changed so they are different. It turns out this file was not
being included in the documentation at all. I submitted a separate
patch to include it: https://review.openstack.org/20551

openstack-compute-admin/computeconfigure.xml:

computeconfigure.xml had xi:include elements with an 'os' attribute.
This violates the spec, and it doesn't work, either. We had two
lines that looked like this:

<xi:include os="ubuntu" ...>
<xi:include os="rhel;fedora;centos" ...>

and both files were being included in the docs. This was changed so
that only one file is included, and there's a note that has been
added that describes the difference between the two files, which
is very minor (just one parameter).

openstack-ha/ha-guide-docinfo.xml:

This isn't a real XML file, it's a fragment of XML that is used
by a non-standard toolchain. The validation script has been configured
to just ignore it for now.

Change-Id: Ie77218efc56c16b7bf162f5e02fd7a6d99116dc1

commit_message:
Include rootwrap.xml in the compute admin guide

There was documentation in the repo that describes how rootwrap works,
but it wasn't actually included in any of the OpenStack doc books as
far as I could tell. This patch includes it in the compute admin guide,
which is where the file is located.

Change-Id: I5e5e0581719e965f0949494623ec4b1de1817348

commit_message:
glance add is deprecated, replace

fixes bug 1105671

glance add is deprecated, and all variables now start with a
double hyphen. Fix the commands that still use this outdated
option.

Also backports the Xen "boot from ISO" docs which weren't in Folsom
before.

'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-01-29 03:03:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

IMO, in general all OVS ports and associated devices created by Quantum (and plug() in Nova VIF driver) should be removed by OVS cleanup utils. So I decided to skip checks for veth devices and remove all remaining ports created by Quantum. It hurts nothing I believe.

At the moment the associated devices are veth devices only (other than OVS internal ports). That's the reason I told only a veth device in the bug report.

Does it make sense?"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-01-29 03:03:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-01-29 03:03:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Frankly speaking my patch focuses on removing ovs ports (more precisely) created by interface driver (it is checked whether an ovs port has external-ids). That is the reason veth devices specific to provider networks in OVS plugin was not deleted.
Interface drivers are relatively common, so I focused on it.

Of course, we can add a logic to remove plugin specific ports. Is it better to remove OVS plugin specific veth devices?
If so we need to parse bridge_mapping in OVS plugin config.

In addition I found linux bridges created by nova hybrid vif driver are not removed while veth devs are removed.
This is another example of implementation specific case.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-29 03:03:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
OVS cleanup utility removes veth pairs

Fixes bug 1094185

OVSInterfaceDriver plug() creates a veth pair and add it to an OVS
bridge when ovs_use_veth=True. It is useful that OVS cleanup utility
removes such veth paris in addition to removing OVS ports.

Veth pairs to be removed are veth devices corresponding to ports
removed when all_ovs_port==False. Veth pairs created to connect
the integration bridge and physical bridges are not removed.

Change-Id: Ia87f0464e69a45dd0bdfd907ac71a003df9fc23f

subject: Enable/disable domains (bug 1100145)
messages:
[{'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-01-16 06:13:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

Checking for disabled domain should be done at authenticate(). Revoked to tokens if revocation list is enabled. Otherwise, revoking token has no effect as PKI tokens can still be validated locally. We just have to document the potential risks."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-01-16 06:28:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

guang-yee: I think if I merged the check to authenticate now, devstack would fail pretty bad, as it should be able to assume that a domain exists (requires the default-domain patch and all ForeignKeys to be populated, which don't even exist on user / projects today).

However, this patch also assumes that users & projects have domain ID's, which is sort of okay because A) this won't be called by anyone but us for now, B) they will have domain_id's by the time this milestone lands."}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-01-16 06:34:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

That's fine. All I am saying is cascade disable is not necessary."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-01-16 06:37:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-01-16 06:42:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Missed your inline comment; shall we revise the spec?'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-01-16 06:42:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Work In Progress

pending discussion'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-01-16 06:57:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Sure. Lets have a pow-wow on this one. Cascade disable seem very inefficient. All we have to do is to *enforce* disabled domains. Implementation details are really up to Keystone. Unless we envision a use case where the disabled flag is significant for the resources contained in a disabled domain.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-01-16 07:01:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm trying to think of exactly that and figure out why I spec'd it as a cascading change -- thinking back to the Folsom summit is really hard :("}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-16 07:30:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/19787/2/check/gate-keystone-docs/1488 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/19787/2/check/gate-keystone-pep8/3004 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/19787/2/check/gate-devstack-vm-quantum/3866 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2013-01-16 21:05:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

A question, what happens on domain delete, does that cascade too? Is it similar enough to disabling?'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-01-16 23:33:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Good question, delete should definitely cascade, as it does with other entities.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-01-17 05:59:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Word. I am also worried about the performance & partial failures of cascade actions. We may need a special dedicated cleanup thread or some sort of partial failed state.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-01-18 17:00:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

gyee: cascading deletes are currently performed within a transaction in the SQL driver; I haven't tested myself, but they shouldn't be committed if a failure occurs. KVS would leave you in an intermediate state, not sure about LDAP."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-01-21 18:07:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-01-21 18:25:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-21 18:56:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

commit_message:
Enable/disable domains (bug 1100145)

Disabling an individual domain denies auth to users and projects owned by
that domain, and revokes all associated tokens. Re-enabling the domain
does not re-enable tokens.

Change-Id: Ic64f59be4f39317f4c365bec185408e79d18c45f

commit_message:
Run setup_develop for tempest.

This setups the development environment for tempest. Without
running setup_develop for tempest import tempest.* breaks
outside of the tempest directory.

Change-Id: I6954733d68125dd116cc9bfa58b9aece674405c3

commit_message:
Use the cliff framework's ShowOne as intended for `show image`.

Also reformat code to follow newer PEP8 version. Full cleanup
and PEP8 version bump coming in later patch.

Change-Id: Ida3dd9a89660b9c4a91449846dd2d6e223ef187a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-22 12:25:20.000000000', 'message': "Change https port to be an optional parameter

VerifiedHTTPSConnection inherits from HTTPSConnection so 'port' should be
an optional argument. If not present it will be set by HTTPSConnection
in the usual way: by parsing the host string (eg 'localhost:8443')
or setting to the default of '443'.

Addresses bug 1102944.

Change-Id: I2c2cb92f824acf15b0ff54590b5614cf206b57e0
"}]
commit_message:
Change https port to be an optional parameter

VerifiedHTTPSConnection inherits from HTTPSConnection so 'port' should be
an optional argument. If not present it will be set by HTTPSConnection
in the usual way: by parsing the host string (eg 'localhost:8443')
or setting to the default of '443'.

Addresses bug 1102944.

Change-Id: I2c2cb92f824acf15b0ff54590b5614cf206b57e0

commit_message:
Allow Moniker Services to Spawn N processes each.

Change-Id: Ib19ed1d7a3edb2c90138490c5c7fd0adde22c245
Warning: This makes no sense for most moniker-agent implementations, and does not currently work with moniker-api due to the point in time where Oslo opens the HTTP socket.

commit_message:
Add TTL to AMQP messages

This patch sets a TTL derived from the timeout parameter used
when invoking the RPC.

Needed for:
 * Bug 1053614

commit_message:
Add doc support for Fixed IPs extension

Modified:  api-ref/src/docbkx/api-ref.xml >> to render new section
Added the fixed-ips.wadl file and two more samples for the unreserve action in api_samples
Renamed and modified previous samples to add some details.
Fixes: bug 1077557

Change-Id: Iefcbcf7963e8c38a37d7bfba353b8be7a8d0fd19

commit_message:
Adding a config option for running XML client

Checking the config to see if we want to use a different client.
This will allow for us to use XML client.

partially implements blueprint test-with-xml
Change-Id: Ifdc1675e708eaad5f2140d9eadc832dc2fc434d2

commit_message:
Make get_security_groups() return security group rules

In nova, get_security_groups() returns the security groups and their
security group rules. In order to implement the security group proxy
it needs to return this data to nova. This can be done using multiple
requests from nova-api to quantum i.e: get_security_groups(), then
get_security_group() for each group to obtain the rules. If one has a lot
of security groups this will generate a lot of requests. Adding this change
allows all the security groups and their rules to be returned in one shot.

Fix bug 1105399

Change-Id: Ib685960311221ac4e5fe0913c7e00e15ab74accb

i.e. rather than trying to fix import_opt(), I think we should add a new "view" class allows creating a filtered view of the global option space so that a user of the view would know they're only using options explicitly imported or registered (i.e. as opposed to options imported or registered by other users of CONF)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-11 19:37:14.000000000', 'message': 'VMware Compute Driver OVF Support

blueprint vmware-compute-driver

Launch OVF disk image
Add support for VMware disk and adapter type

vmware_disktype: eagerZeroedThick, preallocated and sparse
Default value is 'preallocated'.
'sparse' disk refers to OVF supported VMDK format (sparse or streamOptimized).
A sparse disk is copied to thin disk upon deployment.

vmware_adaptertype: ide, busLogic and lsiLogic
Default value is 'lsiLogic'.

Usage:
glance add name="Ubuntu" disk_format=vmdk container_format=ovf is_public=true vmware_adaptertype="lsiLogic" vmware_ostype="ubuntuGuest" vmware_disktype="sparse" < ubuntu-disk1.vmdk

Add support for VNC console

Nova conf:
vnc_enabled=[true|false] defaults to true
vnc_port=[port #] defaults to 5900
vnc_port_total=[total port #] defaults to 10000, the actual VM VNC port is vnc_port + VM ID % vnc_port_total
vnc_password=[optional]

Change-Id: I912b46b9f72f9089b448e03a04327fb79b9f0f3f
'}, {'created': '2013-01-11 21:15:08.000000000', 'message': 'VMware Compute Driver OVF Support

commit_message:
VMware Compute Driver OVF Support

blueprint vmware-compute-driver

Launch OVF disk image
DocImpact
Add support for VMware disk and adapter type

vmware_disktype: eagerZeroedThick, preallocated and sparse
Default value is 'preallocated'.
'sparse' disk refers to OVF supported VMDK format
(sparse or streamOptimized).
A sparse disk is copied to thin disk upon deployment.

vmware_adaptertype: ide, busLogic and lsiLogic
Default value is 'lsiLogic'.

Usage:
glance add name="Ubuntu" disk_format=vmdk container_format=ovf
is_public=true vmware_adaptertype="lsiLogic"
vmware_ostype="ubuntuGuest" vmware_disktype="sparse"
 < ubuntu-disk1.vmdk

Add support for VNC console

Nova conf:
vnc_enabled=[true|false] defaults to true
vnc_port=[port #] defaults to 5900
vnc_port_total=[total port #] defaults to 10000,
the actual VM VNC port is vnc_port + VM ID % vnc_port_total
vnc_password=[optional]

Change-Id: I912b46b9f72f9089b448e03a04327fb79b9f0f3f

commit_message:
Handle access_log_headers in proxy_logging

 * in etc/proxy-server.conf-sample, there is an access_log_headers directive in proxy_logging middleware.
   but current code doesn't handle it. This patch enables proxy_logging to handle access_log_headers.

Change-Id: I03337ccc4f48625af3f578ed543da992d3eec2bd

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-25 16:08:10.000000000', 'message': "Add optional locking to swift-ring-builder

If invoked as 'swift-ring-builder-safe' the directory containing the builder
file provided will be locked (via lock_parent_directory()). This provides a
small safe guard against multiple instances of the swift-ring-builder (or
other utilities that observe this lock) from attempting to write to or read
the builder/ring files while operations are in progress.

This is particularly useful in environments where ring management has been
automated (via Chef or custom solutions) but the operator still occasionally
needs to manually interact with the ring.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ia362744a8151a91bfb586d01da582906726852e6
"}]
commit_message:
Add optional locking to swift-ring-builder

If invoked as 'swift-ring-builder-safe' the directory containing the builder
file provided will be locked (via lock_parent_directory()). This provides a
small safe guard against multiple instances of the swift-ring-builder (or
other utilities that observe this lock) from attempting to write to or read
the builder/ring files while operations are in progress.

This is particularly useful in environments where ring management has been
automated (via Chef or custom solutions) but the operator still occasionally
needs to manually interact with the ring.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ia362744a8151a91bfb586d01da582906726852e6

glance add is depreciated, replace

fixes bug 1105671

glance add is depreciated, and all variables now start with a
double hyphen. Fix the commands that still use this outdated
option.

Change-Id: Ief6dbdf1479097d985b343545b8730513098870f

messages:
[{'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-01-23 02:28:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@rmk feedback from IRC

[21:21] <dims> rmk, does mkdtemp create parent directories if they don't exist?
[21:22] <lifeless> dims: rmk: mkdtemp - no.
[21:22] <lifeless> is this in the test code? for that TempDir() is better.
[21:24] <dims> lifeless, was looking at rmk's review - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/20288/1/nova/utils.py,unified
[21:25] <lifeless> ah
[21:25] <lifeless> that will require the configured root dir to pre-exist
[21:26] <lifeless> mkdtemp does not make containing dirs (And it cannot safely - that would be a massive race condition waiting for exploit)"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-23 02:34:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/20288/1/check/gate-nova-docs/13001 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/20288/1/check/gate-nova-pep8/18307 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/20288/1/check/gate-nova-python26/14465 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/20288/1/check/gate-nova-python27/14515 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/20288/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/27894 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/20288/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/2279 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/20288/1/check/gate-nova-pylint/6795 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 1525, 'date': '2013-01-23 03:20:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'd like to keep this change as simple as possible.  Would it be reasonable to simply check whether tempdir exists and throw an exception (logging accordingly) if it does not?  I think if a user is defining a tempdir explicitly, they should be responsible for making sure it's present and has the right permissions."}, {'account_id': 1525, 'date': '2013-01-23 03:22:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I should add that all the patch does is allow for setting, via config, what can already be set if the user sets TMPDIR, TEMP or TMP via the environment (in that order). We're just overriding all 3 of those if the config option is set in Nova.  Point is, we're not really changing the behavior, just adding convenience."}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-01-23 12:58:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

What does happen if someone sets a tempdir that doesn't exist, with your patch as is?

It does seem to have a very slight change in behaviour, since it appears that configdrive defaults to using tempfile.tempdir.  But I'm just being nitpicky, I don't think that's a problem."}, {'account_id': 5174, 'date': '2013-01-23 16:56:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-01-23 18:47:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Needs tests to ensure that it works as expected, in the default case, as well as with this specified.

Also, needs DocImpact as it affects a config option."}, {'account_id': 1525, 'date': '2013-01-23 20:02:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-01-23 20:02:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 1525, 'date': '2013-01-23 20:06:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

DocImpact flag added.

I honestly do not agree this change necessitates a test.  We're making a single additional call to a built in library.  If anyone has the cycles and would like to write a test, please feel free to amend this commit and add it."}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-01-23 20:15:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@rmk, i don't mind this going in w/o a test. can you confirm what happens when the directory does not exist? do we bailout or does it default to its usual behavior? At least so we can warn users to create the directory and restart."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-23 20:29:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/20288/2/check/gate-nova-docs/13074 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/20288/2/check/gate-nova-pep8/18380 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/20288/2/check/gate-nova-python26/14538 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/20288/2/check/gate-nova-pylint/6831 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 1525, 'date': '2013-01-23 20:49:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

If tempdir=/foo and it doesn't exit, an exception gets thrown:

2013-01-23 20:42:16.315 AUDIT nova.compute.manager [req-b5dec494-02c2-499f-a959-e104bfa3d73f admin demo] [instance: d99e44d8-2d96-4788-b802-10197d3e77de] instance snapshotting
2013-01-23 20:42:19.23 ERROR nova.openstack.common.rpc.amqp [req-b5dec494-02c2-499f-a959-e104bfa3d73f admin demo] Exception during message handling
TRACE nova.openstack.common.rpc.amqp OSError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/foo/tmptCeehV'

The same thing would happen today if one of the environment variables is set to a non-existent directory.  I'm open to adding more handling around this as a general improvement, if that's desired."}, {'account_id': 1525, 'date': '2013-01-23 20:58:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

My original goal for this patch was to deal with temporary snapshot placement, which turns out is solved in the libvirt driver:

snapshot_directory = CONF.libvirt_snapshots_directory
fileutils.ensure_tree(snapshot_directory)
with utils.tempdir(dir=snapshot_directory) as tmpdir:

Maybe we should run fileutils.ensure_tree when the tempdir config option is set?'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-01-23 21:18:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@rmk - anything that would help the user quickly point to a the config entry as a source of the problem would get my vote'}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-01-23 21:22:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I was hoping the error message would be more informative as to the cause.  As it is it seems like it will take more time than should be necessary to trace the issue back to a config value pointing to a directory that doesn't exist.

I think using fileutils.ensure_tree is a good way to address it, though I wish it didn't have to be tested everytime.

I'm also ok with the lack of testing as I'm not sure how to get reasonable assurances in unit testing, but it would be great know that these assumptions are tested in devstack/tempest."}, {'account_id': 1525, 'date': '2013-01-26 20:55:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1525, 'date': '2013-01-26 21:01:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Added a new function (which I suspect we'll expand the use of over time) to validate config options, where I've added validation of tempdir.  Here's what it looks like if you point at a directory which does not exist.

2013-01-26 20:51:50.303 ERROR nova.service [-] Temporary directory /rmk specified but does not exist"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-26 21:16:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 1525, 'date': '2013-01-26 21:18:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1525, 'date': '2013-01-26 21:22:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Modified the validation approach to actually attempt using the tempdir on startup.  Now it doesn't matter how it's specified (default, environment variable, config flag), we'll catch the problem regardless."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-26 21:39:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

commit_message:
Allow users to specify a tmp location via config

Fixes bug 981104

Although the temporary directory used can be controlled via
environment variables, this patch provides a way to define it
explicitly via a config option.

The default value is None, which behaves per the doc below:
http://docs.python.org/2/library/tempfile.html#tempfile.tempdir

Flags: DocImpact
Change-Id: I47b6d8bac734f453c80d541b46086a30e847c859

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-28 16:36:35.000000000', 'message': 'Update nova notifier test after nova change

Nova's code path for cleaning up an instance was modified
to log errors to the database, but our tests don't set
up that part of the schema. Use patch to replace the
function that is trying to log the error.

The instance structure also expects to have a "system_metadata"
key in order to complete the cleanup, so add that to our
test data.

Change-Id: I4bc1d2c8b443a51cef8b13b0627010a6f06c42cf
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Update nova notifier test after nova change

Nova's code path for cleaning up an instance was modified
to log errors to the database, but our tests don't set
up that part of the schema. Use patch to replace the
function that is trying to log the error.

The instance structure also expects to have a "system_metadata"
key in order to complete the cleanup, so add that to our
test data.

Change-Id: I4bc1d2c8b443a51cef8b13b0627010a6f06c42cf
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Strip out Traceback from HTTP response

We should not let stack traces leak to the REST API users

Fixes LP# 1103324
Fixes LP# 1092610

commit_message:
Fix a typo of log message in _poll_unconfirmed_resizes

That is just a negligible typo issue, so I have not filed a bug on LP.
The typo log message is like "notRESIZED/None", and should be
"not RESIZED/None".

Change-Id: I6137b477185419b1e638be3ed5310644aff96d76

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-27 23:00:30.000000000', 'message': "Avoid hard dependency on python-coverage.

Updates the coverage extension in the OpenStack Compute API to
avoid a hard dependency on the python coverage module. We now
try to import 'coverage' and if it isn't present we return
an HTTP 503 (service unavailable error).

This gets rid of WARNING errors which occur when running Nova API
when the 'coverage' module is not available:

2013-01-27 17:10:28.938 16018 WARNING nova.api.openstack.compute.contrib
[-] Failed to load extension
nova.api.openstack.compute.contrib.coverage_ext.Coverage_ext: No module
named coverage

Fixes LP Bug #1101057.

Change-Id: I573180aead44d68b8377cd66f30fc6ac849d0272
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid hard dependency on python-coverage.

Updates the coverage extension in the OpenStack Compute API to
avoid a hard dependency on the python coverage module. We now
try to import 'coverage' and if it isn't present we return
an HTTP 503 (service unavailable error).

This gets rid of WARNING errors which occur when running Nova API
when the 'coverage' module is not available:

2013-01-27 17:10:28.938 16018 WARNING nova.api.openstack.compute.contrib
[-] Failed to load extension
nova.api.openstack.compute.contrib.coverage_ext.Coverage_ext: No module
named coverage

Fixes LP Bug #1101057.

Change-Id: I573180aead44d68b8377cd66f30fc6ac849d0272

Deleted unused method restart_with_sync

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-19 04:39:00.000000000', 'message': "public_endpoint & admin_endpoint configuration

Today we can use these configuration values to avoid having to guess
keystone's own endpoint URL from the service catalog backend, which may
contain more than one identity endpoint.

This is also the first step towards adding self-relational links to the v3 API.

Change-Id: I375ac0d1f9581592e437c67c17bf32022f652f66
"}]
commit_message:
public_endpoint & admin_endpoint configuration

Today we can use these configuration values to avoid having to guess
keystone's own endpoint URL from the service catalog backend, which may
contain more than one identity endpoint.

This is also the first step towards adding self-relational links to the v3 API.

Change-Id: I375ac0d1f9581592e437c67c17bf32022f652f66

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-23 13:17:48.000000000', 'message': "Add version constraint for coverage

Python coverage lower than 3.6 causes issues when running the whole
test suite. Some arguments are randomly mixed up with script names,
resulting in unittest failures like this:

UnexpectedMethodCallError: Unexpected method call.  unexpected:-  expected:+
- exists.__call__('/tmp/buildd/.../nova/virt/images.py') -> None
+ exists.__call__('/some/path') -> True

Change-Id: Iadb6d046e3acc75c6ed5abffcfc1abda82aeee4f
"}]
commit_message:
Add version constraint for coverage

Python coverage lower than 3.6 causes issues when running the whole
test suite. Some arguments are randomly mixed up with script names,
resulting in unittest failures like this:

UnexpectedMethodCallError: Unexpected method call.  unexpected:-  expected:+
- exists.__call__('/tmp/buildd/.../nova/virt/images.py') -> None
+ exists.__call__('/some/path') -> True

Change-Id: Iadb6d046e3acc75c6ed5abffcfc1abda82aeee4f

[{'created': '2013-01-21 16:17:52.000000000', 'message': 'Fix thinko in self.middleware.cert_file_missing

The function always found the needle in the haystack
because it did not check for find() returning something
unequal to -1.

Also added a rather trivial test.

Change-Id: If0b4fed6fe676cad50512267c1b601a3a8a631e5
'}, {'created': '2013-01-22 08:41:50.000000000', 'message': 'Fix thinko in self.middleware.cert_file_missing

The python function string.find() returns -1 on a miss,
which is also evaluated as True. Therefore checking for
a return value >= 0 instead.

Also added a rather trivial test to test for this
code bug.

Change-Id: If0b4fed6fe676cad50512267c1b601a3a8a631e5
'}, {'created': '2013-01-22 09:08:19.000000000', 'message': "Fix thinko in self.middleware.cert_file_missing

The python function string.find() returns -1 on a miss,
which is also evaluated as True. Therefore checking for
a return value >= 0 instead.

Also added a rather trivial test to test for this
code bug. In order to make the code easier to test,
I've changed the parameters to operate on the command
output, not the exception object and updated all callers.

commit_message:
Fix thinko in self.middleware.cert_file_missing

The python function string.find() returns -1 on a miss,
which is also evaluated as True. Therefore use the
"X in Y" approach instead.

Also added a rather trivial test to test for this
code bug. In order to make the code easier to test,
I've changed the parameters to operate on the command
output, not the exception object and updated all callers.

Change-Id: If0b4fed6fe676cad50512267c1b601a3a8a631e5

commit_message:
Use testtools as the base testcase class.

Use testtools as the base unittest test case class towards to
parallelizing the test runs. Catch places where setUp and tearDown
were not being chained properly, and fix these problems.Remove
custom skip, using testtools.skip instead. Add TestResourceManager.

Part of blueprint speed-up-tempest

commit_message:
Move policy checks to calling side of rpc.

This prepares to move some of the functionality in the manager
up to the api. We previously did policy checking on the manager
side because quantum v1 was a manager. Now that quantum replaces
the api, we can do the policy checking on the api side.

Change-Id: Id404c66e61044b880dbfb11f7cbba20cbab4b527

commit_message:
Add install_venv library.

This adds a install_venv.py library that can be used by each
project's tools/install_venv.py script.

Currently all the projects have very similar install_venv
scripts in their respective tools directories that all
accomplish the same end result. This just breaks out the
common code and puts it in a class that can be imported
and used in each project's script.

Change-Id: I8346fc4201f35e5d0c475caef893ca71e7db8236

Prevent parallel test port clashes for zmq.

The scheme of incrementing port numbers did not work so well for
parallel test runs.

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools.

commit_message:
Replace direct use of testtools BaseTestCase.

Using the BaseTestCase across the tests in the tree lets us put in log
fixtures and consistently handle mox and stubout.

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools.

Remove the last of the nose-isms.

testtools provides a skipTest method, so there's no need to pull in nose
directly into the tests.

Part of blueprint grizzly/testtools.

Change-Id: I97a9f09a27cad0433949a96fc18001ecf69c8ba2
