revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-24 19:10:04.000000000', 'message': "Use babel to generate translation file

Fixes bug 1103519

Following http://wiki.openstack.org/Translations to integrate transifex
translation into quantum

We added the empty file quantum/locale/quantum.pot to avoid the
failure of the Jenkin's translation-jobs because git doesn't allow empty
directory to be added into the repository.

After this patch accepted, we need to do as below:
1. Make the transifex quantum project
(https://www.transifex.com/projects/p/quantum/) as part of the
openstack transifex project hub and give access to the transifex
openstack Jenkins account.

2. Add the translation-jobs into openstack/openstack-ci-puppet for
ceilometer.

Change-Id: I329a8bdc51ed8a0e75399c592d3991b1ec06a855
"}, {'created': '2013-01-24 19:10:04.000000000', 'message': "Use babel to generate translation file

Fixes bug 1103519

Following http://wiki.openstack.org/Translations to integrate transifex
translation into quantum

We added the empty file ceilometer/locale/ceilometer.pot to avoid the
failure of the Jenkin's translation-jobs because git doesn't allow empty
directory to be added into the repository.

After this patch accepted, we need to do as below:
1. Make the transifex quantum project
(https://www.transifex.com/projects/p/quantum/) as part of the
openstack transifex project hub and give access to the transifex
openstack Jenkins account.

2. Add the translation-jobs into openstack/openstack-ci-puppet for
ceilometer.

Change-Id: I329a8bdc51ed8a0e75399c592d3991b1ec06a855
"}]
commit_message:
Use babel to generate translation file

Fixes bug 1103519

Following http://wiki.openstack.org/Translations to integrate transifex
translation into quantum

We added the empty file quantum/locale/quantum.pot to avoid the
failure of the Jenkin's translation-jobs because git doesn't allow empty
directory to be added into the repository.

After this patch accepted, we need to do as below:
1. Make the transifex quantum project
(https://www.transifex.com/projects/p/quantum/) as part of the
openstack transifex project hub and give access to the transifex
openstack Jenkins account.

2. Add the translation-jobs into openstack/openstack-ci-puppet for
ceilometer.

Change-Id: I329a8bdc51ed8a0e75399c592d3991b1ec06a855

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-24 06:13:42.000000000', 'message': 'Use pkg_resources to detect version of cloud-init

Previously the present of an API call only present in cloud-init 0.6.x
was used to determine whether or not cfn-userdata would have been executed
or not. The API call was removed in 0.7.x. This Fixes bug #1103793

Change-Id: I27129f8ae6144ae7172b7159ed70fc5f0d7d07b9
'}]
commit_message:
Use pkg_resources to detect version of cloud-init

Previously the present of an API call only present in cloud-init 0.6.x
was used to determine whether or not cfn-userdata would have been executed
or not. The API call was removed in 0.7.x. This Fixes bug #1103793

Change-Id: I27129f8ae6144ae7172b7159ed70fc5f0d7d07b9

commit_message:
Test to check container synchronization

Adds a new test script test_container_sync.py to
./tests/object_storage so as to verfify the container to
container synchronization support.

Change-Id: If880ab0e62465c32113cfde2b864841fa363ad19
Implements: blueprint add-swift-container-sync-test

commit_message:
Import timeutils.is_soon from keystoneclient

This is a function defined as will_expire_soon at least twice in
python-keystoneclient, and it's actually quite handy. There is a comment on
that code about moving to timeutils, and it actually sounds like a good idea
since I'm likely to use it in Ceilometer, so here it is.

Change-Id: Idf208ce9e7ce9048a38d98212b7f730c6b7c8288
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
Ensure package-wide test init is done with testr

This patch adds testresources.ResourcedTestCase as another base class
for compute and boto tests. This allows us to perform package-wide
init for tests when running them under testr. The init was not being
performed when the tests were run under testr because setup_package is
a nosetests specific init feature. The setup_package functions in
__init__.py files are renamed to ensure that the initialisation is
only done once.

Implements: blueprint speed-up-tempest
Change-Id: If76f71cb06f2243607db2680504e94dc65e1f585

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-01-24 17:07:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

I would say that if we merge this change, it really needs to support the old syntax as well (without specifying the flavor and image as positional arguments).  Otherwise it's going to cause a lot of existing examples / scripts / etc to stop working.

It may turn out that supporting both just isn't practical and we need to leave it how it is."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-01-24 17:12:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

and actually, as we discussed on IRC, the test cases you removed were for cases where --image isn't actually required, so it shouldn't be a positional argument.

Theat leaves just flavor.  I'm not sure it's worth trying to support just flavor as both positional and a keyword argument ..."}, {'account_id': 6316, 'date': '2013-01-24 17:15:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

In conversation with Russell Bryant and Julie Pich on IRC, it is determined that the original bug report might not have been valid.'}]

commit_message:
Add support for EC2 tag API

This change has two parts:

First, the API needs to actually pass filter arguments back to the model
layer so that filtered searching works.  This addresses launchpad bug
922835 and makes the tag filtering possible.

Secondly, implement the API calls CreateTags, DescribeTags and
DeleteTags and the CRUD calls to support them.  Unlike EC2, only
instance tagging is currently supported.  Glance/Quantum/Cinder/Swift
etc will need to implement tagging independently if they want to support
this as well.

Implements: EC2 tag API for instances
Fixes: bugs #770070, #922835, #1096821

Change-Id: Iaf32d349fbf828696c501777172ce62616771f32
Signed-off-by: Stephen Gran <stephen.gran@guardian.co.uk>

[{'created': '2013-01-24 16:56:53.000000000', 'message': 'Fixing race condition during instance deletion.

Defer to the superclass to check if the instance is building
which handles more edge cases. This will prevent the instance
from being deleted while it is still being built.

Fixes: bug #1101380
'}]
commit_message:
Fixing race condition during instance deletion.

Defer to the superclass to check if the instance is building
which handles more edge cases. This will prevent the instance
from being deleted while it is still being built.

Change-Id: I35b71931c7eec0ab7dfcec46f2ed4500f8803281
Fixes: bug #1101380

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-24 16:48:14.000000000', 'message': 'Negative Taskmanager Resize/Migration fixes.

* Revert barrier should be right after Verify_RESIZE is confirmed, but
  before confirming flavor for a resize action.
* Verify nova server status before restarting mysql.
  If anything goes wrong during resize/migrate actions, taskmanager
  first checks that the Nova server status is ACTIVE and only then make
  the call to restart MySQL.

Fixes: bug #1102523

Change-Id: Ibca436d7fdcdef9f1afcec111da84891cd15353c
'}]
commit_message:
Negative Taskmanager Resize/Migration fixes.

* Revert barrier should be right after Verify_RESIZE is confirmed, but
  before confirming flavor for a resize action.
* Verify nova server status before restarting mysql.
  If anything goes wrong during resize/migrate actions, taskmanager
  first checks that the Nova server status is ACTIVE and only then make
  the call to restart MySQL.

Fixes: bug #1102523

Change-Id: Ibca436d7fdcdef9f1afcec111da84891cd15353c

[{'created': '2013-01-24 16:37:41.000000000', 'message': 'Parametrize service_host value in the test config

Parametrize service_host value in the test config to be based on
actual value of SERVICE_HOST from devstack/vmgate config. This is
needed for the vm-gate integration piece. The vm-gate driver to devstack
uses 127.0.0.1 instead of localhost which causes a mismatch in the
reddwarf URLs checked by the tests, so these need to be set correctly.

Fixes bug 1103778

Change-Id: If544db2eb0e9fec5c5b35f6551ae0e7b648d35ae
'}]
commit_message:
Parametrize service_host value in the test config

Parametrize service_host value in the test config to be based on
actual value of SERVICE_HOST from devstack/vmgate config. This is
needed for the vm-gate integration piece. The vm-gate driver to devstack
uses 127.0.0.1 instead of localhost which causes a mismatch in the
reddwarf URLs checked by the tests, so these need to be set correctly.

Fixes bug 1103778

Change-Id: If544db2eb0e9fec5c5b35f6551ae0e7b648d35ae

generate it.

commit_message:
TestCase to check set/get/unset flavor extraspecs

Adds functions in flavors_client.py to set/get/unset extra specs for
a flavor. Script by the name test_flavors_extra_specs.py is added so
as test the actions of set/get/unset extra specs for a flavor.

Change-Id: I1b57e8434fdef28676bdc4068760fe83054fb4f8
Implements: blueprint nova-grizzly1-blueprints-implementation

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-21 20:50:43.000000000', 'message': "Add support for SPICE consoles

While in theory both VNC and SPICE can be enabled at the same
time, this is not expected to be common. Thus, rather than
adding a 'SPICE console' tab, this renames the existing
'VNC console' tab to simply be 'Console'. This tab is setup
to prefer exposing a VNC console, but if that is not enabled,
then expose the SPICE console. The reason for this order is
that the noVNC widget has had much more testing than the
current spice-html5 widget. Thus if both VNC & SPICE are
enabled, VNC is likely a more reliable choice at this point
in time.

Blueprint: libvirt-spice
Change-Id: If3d3769fe8e29c5930ac8b42d841c92182c4be72
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2013-01-22 17:55:51.000000000', 'message': "Add support for SPICE consoles

commit_message:
Add support for SPICE consoles

While in theory both VNC and SPICE can be enabled at the same
time, this is not expected to be common. Thus, rather than
adding a 'SPICE console' tab, this renames the existing
'VNC console' tab to simply be 'Console'. This tab is setup
to prefer exposing a VNC console, but if that is not enabled,
then expose the SPICE console. The reason for this order is
that the noVNC widget has had much more testing than the
current spice-html5 widget. Thus if both VNC & SPICE are
enabled, VNC is likely a more reliable choice at this point
in time.

Blueprint: libvirt-spice
Change-Id: If3d3769fe8e29c5930ac8b42d841c92182c4be72
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

optional config group. Also fix the baremetal database

'}]
commit_message:
Add support for Option Groups in LazyPluggable

Use @markmc's suggestion to enhance LazyPluggable with an
optional config group. Also fix the baremetal database
backend option to use the "baremetal" config group.

Fixes LP #1093043

Change-Id: I28cf51a2962f516fcef4ced19e30c985220e86dc

commit_message:
get_security_group() now returns rules

get_security_group() previously only returned a security_group's id,
name, tenant_id, and description. This patch changes get_security_group()
to also return the security_group_rules associated with the security group.
Fixed bug 1103278

Change-Id: Iebc0022faa5c7072380d52b81c13783add0f4d46

commit_message:
Adds port security api extension and base class

Implements blueprint port-security-api-base-class
This patch also updates the _create_network/port in the unit tests
so that it does not remove false values from arg_list.
Fixes bug 1097527

Change-Id: I22b55b0ed56c830995ffb491176c801c697abe6f

commit_message:
Cells: use update_cells argument

The function instance_info_cache_update has an update_cells argument like
many others function in the nova.db.api module, but this one doesn't use it.
This is probably mistake, so let's use it!

Change-Id: I222d98010cff55ca3e9c1f37a2080f624acf3c7b
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
Add ability to call force_delete from cinderclient

We have an admin extension to do this however we never
exposed it via the cinderclient.

This change simply enables access to force-delete for admins.

Change-Id: Ia066d7dd06ccdb9b3a9221cf33086437624e65d8

commit_message:
Add a simple implementation of element dependency

This adds a new optional file to the root of elements. The
file lists dependencies which will be added to the list
requested by the user during disk image creation.

Change-Id: Id71c3b333563604bbbaf90f9cf40e24fa9738fc8

this fundamentally breaks the concept of what a service catalog is and should be, and this spec change doesn't do anything to address that."}, {'account_id': 1228, 'date': '2013-01-06 15:13:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Joe H, can you provide more info on how this breaks the service catalog concept ? 

Thanks,
Joe'}, {'account_id': 143, 'date': '2013-01-07 17:33:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-07 17:33:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/19014/2/check/gate-noop/149 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 143, 'date': '2013-01-07 17:36:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I think I see what you're saying Joe H.

The project id must be reflected on the auth response and in the service catalog.  I believe that we did this in v2, but not in v3 -- the second patch should fix."}, {'account_id': 1228, 'date': '2013-01-07 19:48:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-01-08 14:27:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

So while I can see how the proposed api changes would get you a token....as discussed on irc, what changes would be needed to the authorisation structure & policy engines to process this (i.e. I assume you could have multiple projects with potentially different roles on each)?

The suggested use case I have heard so far is for, say, the transfer of resources from one project to another.  Given that this is likely to take many individual api calls to do such a transfer, is the overhead of just getting two individual-project tokens at the start large enough to justify this level of change?  Or maybe there are more complex use cases where we really need these multi-project tokens?  Given that I believe you can effectively do this in v2....do we have some data or client code that shows the savings we can make?"}, {'account_id': 143, 'date': '2013-01-08 16:36:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Note that we use the Keystone API and the service catalog to manage all of our services...public / private - even non-IaaS and non-OpenStack services (billing, contact, support, etc).

A use cases we run into in this world is that an existing service usas a project structure and project ids, that are different from the one that the OpenStack implementation is using.  So a single token may need to access different project ids simultaneously.'}, {'account_id': 143, 'date': '2013-01-14 10:14:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-14 10:14:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/19014/3/check/gate-noop/204 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 143, 'date': '2013-01-14 10:18:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Okay, based on discussions with Joe S, moving roles under project.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-01-14 17:33:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(4 inline comments)

a couple nits inline"}, {'account_id': 143, 'date': '2013-01-14 20:44:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-14 20:44:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/19014/4/check/gate-noop/210 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 143, 'date': '2013-01-14 20:46:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Addressed minor issues pointed out by dolph.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-01-15 00:26:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Such a token is entirely incompatible with the current middleware contract with underlying services (X-Project-Id is just a single ID, not a list). Therefore we would also need to agree on a proper response / status code to return to end-users in the event that they authenticate with keystone for a multi-project token, but the service they are trying to use it with does not support them.

A middleware configuration variable such as `allow_multiproject_tokens` (defaulting to false) could allow consuming services to opt-in for X-Project-Ids (thus disabling X-Project-Id support).'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-01-16 01:23:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

Still too many unknowns. I am also worry about backward compatibility."}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2013-01-16 01:40:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

per the discussion in http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/keystone/2013/keystone.2013-01-15-18.02.log.html, this is a change-the-spec-technical-solution to a poorly integrated business merger.

This isn't appropriate as a spec change, especially given the implications and rollout that changing the format and fundamentals of the token will incur. At best, this change will take 2 full openstack releases to roll effectively roll out, assuming that we *support* this spec change. If we don't support and implement the spec change, this is whole effort is specious.

A more appropriate immediate technical solution to RAX's business issue would be an site-specific implementation(middleware or such) that allow tokens to be translated to the correct project on one service endpoint or the other, or extension data that's included in the token that RAX can use and support, but does not go into the formal spec. A more appropriate long term solution is continuing to drive the concept and implementation of federation and support for multiple authentication endpoints with a seamless way of merging and using that authentication and authorization data."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-01-16 02:42:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

"}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-01-16 06:18:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-01-16 06:50:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-01-24 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Multi-project tokens in Identity API

This documents the v3 api changes proposed to represent support for
multi-project tokens in keystone.  Consult the blueprint for
details:

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/multiproject-token-api

DocImpact

Change-Id: I53fb76ebca89d6c6f31195adf2f2acd02bff3452

"python-ceilometerclient" doesn't exist in pypi - it looks like the dependency name would be ceilometer or ceilometerclient? I'm not sure which is the preferred client.

Another concern would be that as far as I understand it, we only add support for incubated projects in Horizon when they become core. See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2012-December/003813.html'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-16 10:48:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.

"}, {'account_id': 1952, 'date': '2013-01-16 10:52:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

It's python-ceilometerclient which is the same as python-glanceclient or other clients.

I will try to upload this client to pip.

BTW, how can I solve this if ceilometer is still an incubated project?"}, {'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2013-01-16 11:14:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Cool, re:uploading python-ceilometerclient to pip/pypi!

Heat's Horizon UI seems to be living in github while waiting for Heat to be promoted to Core (https://github.com/heat-api/heat-horizon). StackForge would be another option (http://ci.openstack.org/stackforge.html) although I'm not sure what would be the best way to take advantage of the CI features in that case."}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2013-01-16 22:03:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Do not merge

I'm gonna agree with Julie that for now I'd like to see development for this happen in a branch rather than being added bit by bit during the incubation phase. That's largely how the quantum development happened.

Posting the code on github is strongly encouraged so that we can still review, give feedback, etc. during the development. This will also give us time to work through the UX aspects of exposing ceilometer in the most useful way.

However, if we get to a point where the ceilometer integration works well and is providing a valuable experience in the dashboard then I'd certainly consider landing it en masse in a release even if ceilometer is still in incubation.

To sum up, I don't want to land this as a series of small patches while in incubation, but if you do the work to make something awesome I'd glad land it in full as a "beta" feature. :-)'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-01-24 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-01-24 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2013-01-10 16:41:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Do not merge

I'm not sure I buy this. The change you are proposing is altering the default behavior of a Keystone middleware (https://github.com/openstack/python-keystoneclient/blob/master/keystoneclient/middleware/auth_token.py#L241). Why do you feel this bug is specific to Glance and should not be 'fixed' upstream in python-keystoneclient?"}, {'account_id': 4375, 'date': '2013-01-11 08:57:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

It's triggered when I use glanceclient, i.e. "glance image-list" as, say, the root user but glance (and keystone) both run under different users. This is not specific to glance, nova currently has a similar fix (commit 38334ed7). Before bug 1031022, the auth middleware always used '/tmp/keystone-signing', but it should be individual per service. You're right, either every component uses a custom default path (like in this review) or keystone(client) would have to check from which component it is invoked (and add the name as a path suffix). Dunno if the keystone guys would want that though.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2013-01-16 17:17:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm not sure I understand the problem 100%. I'll ping Joe Heck and get his input."}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2013-01-16 17:32:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

this isn't something that should get coded into glance-api-paste.ini at a project level, it's an implementation specific choice that you're suggesting to codify into this project. 

auth_token allows this to be configured very intentionally, with a detail of the home directory, *expecting* that value to be changed and set to be appropriate to the local system. auth_token, BTW - will get run as the glance user, not as the keystone user - although if you have both services running on the same machine, they could compete to write files into this directory, which may be some of what you saw."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-01-24 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-01-24 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
Set default signing_dir in etc/glance-api-paste.ini

Currently, if not set, the default in keystone/middleware/auth_token.py
is $HOME/signing_dir (See bug 1031022, bug 1031008 and bug 1036847)
which may fail depending on the user glance / glanceclient is run and
the home directory set.

/tmp is always writable and the directory name is unique enough

Change-Id: I3a8de371ccdf52a8ebe31e6dc1b5f1cc3e95b0ef

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-04 01:59:44.000000000', 'message': 'Replaces the Hyper-V testing framework

This patch replaces the previous testing framework based on serialized/pickled
mock objects with a new approach based on automatically or manually generated
Python modules and classes. As a result, the time required to write
fake/stub/mock classes decreases dramatically while mantaining the flexibility
required for manually adding custom behaviours to the mock classes.

Automatic mock modules and classes generation is optional. Python files
can be generated by running the unit tests against the real infrastructure
(e.g. hypervisor, network, volumes, etc.) setting the environment variable
EMIT_TEST_MOCKS=True

The advantage of this approach is that the time required to create manual
fake/stub/mock classes and modules is reduced almost to zero, code
coverage can increase easily and developers have a framework for testing
new features against a real environment or the corresponding mocks with a
simple switch.

The generated python files can be edited manually or created from scratch
without the need of Hyper-V or any other integration layer.

Change-Id: I463a7d7aeeed190d55bb0e8ad40848fba4187898

commit_message:
Replaces the Hyper-V testing framework

This patch replaces the previous testing framework based on serialized/pickled
mock objects with a new approach based on automatically or manually generated
Python modules and classes. As a result, the time required to write
fake/stub/mock classes decreases dramatically while mantaining the flexibility
required for manually adding custom behaviours to the mock classes.

Automatic mock modules and classes generation is optional. Python files
can be generated by running the unit tests against the real infrastructure
(e.g. hypervisor, network, volumes, etc.) setting the environment variable
EMIT_TEST_MOCKS=True

The advantage of this approach is that the time required to create manual
fake/stub/mock classes and modules is reduced almost to zero, code
coverage can increase easily and developers have a framework for testing
new features against a real environment or the corresponding mocks with a
simple switch.

The generated python files can be edited manually or created from scratch
without the need of Hyper-V or any other integration layer.

Change-Id: I463a7d7aeeed190d55bb0e8ad40848fba4187898

commit_message:
Use FLAGS.volume_name_template on iscsi removal

iscsi.remove_iscsi_target had the volume name prefix
hard-coded to the default "volume-", which causes the
removal to fail on installs that have a non-default
volume_name_template.

Fixes bug: 1101071

Change-Id: I433a8715bfa6fbde27db33557b581c4d7a23ae23

Backup files (foo~) are not interesting for a pep8 report.

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-27 00:07:15.000000000', 'message': "Provide creating real unique indexes for columns.

Main issue is that we can't create unique constraint for columns, becouse
we use soft deletion of entries (set `deleted` column to True).

The main idea is to use `deleted` columns to create unique constraint for
columns. For example (`col1`, `deleted`).

To make (`col1`, `deleted`) unqiue after entrie `deletion` we should assign
`deleted` column value of entrie id.

Change type of `deleted` column from Boolean to table.id.type for all tables.

Change models delete() method to assign table.id instead of True to `deleted`
column.

Value of `deleted` property of entries is used in public nova api. To keep API
as is, so we should change XMLDictSerializer adding converting type of
`deleted` property to string representation of boolean.

blueprint db-unique-keys

Change-Id: Ie1f67f49a5d085e6371efb63fc23a1c8b25d9464

commit_message:
Provide creating real unique constraints for columns

Main issue is that we can't create unique constraint for columns, because
we are using soft deletion of entries (set `deleted` column to True).

The main idea is to use `deleted` columns to create unique constraint for
columns. For example (`col1`, `deleted`).

To make (`col1`, `deleted`) unique after entry deletion, we should assign the
value of `id` to `deleted` column.

Change type of `deleted` column from Boolean to table.id.type for all tables.

Change models.soft_delete() method to assign table.id instead of True to
`deleted` column.

Change query.soft_delete() method to assign literal_column("id") instead of True

Change in db.models all occurrences of Table.deleted == False =>
Table.deleted == correct_type (0 or "")

Value of `deleted` property of entries is used in public nova api. To keep API
as is, we should change XMLDictSerializer by converting the type of
`deleted` property to string representation of boolean.

Change db.api.model_query() method to make it work with different types
of `deleted` column.
If we are using as model that is not subclass of NovaBase we should set
parameter base_model as subclass of NovaBase that corresponds to model.

Change in db.api all occurrences of using model_query with model that is not
subclass of NovaBase.

blueprint db-unique-keys

Change-Id: Ie1f67f49a5d085e6371efb63fc23a1c8b25d9464
